title.raw: 《秦始皇本紀》 Annals of Qin Shi Huang

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝者，秦莊襄王子也。

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang Di was Qin Zhuang Xiang Wang's son.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Shihuangdi was the son of King Zhuangxiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王為秦質子於趙，見呂不韋姬，悅而取之，生始皇。

translations.literal: Zhuang Xiang Wang was Qin hostage in Zhao, saw Lu Bu Wei's concubine, pleased and took her, gave birth to Shi Huang.
translations.idiomatic: While King Zhuangxiang was a hostage of Qin in Zhao, he saw Lü Buwei's concubine, took pleasure in her, married her, and she gave birth to the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 以秦昭王四十八年正月生於邯鄲。

translations.literal: He was born in Handan in the first month of the forty-eighth year of King Zhaoxiang of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: He was born in Handan in the first month of Qin King Zhaoxiang's forty-eighth year.

sentences.zh: 及生，名為政，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: Upon his birth, he was named Zheng and given the surname Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: When he was born, he was named Zheng and took the surname Zhao.

sentences.zh: 年十三歲，莊襄王死，政代立為秦王。

translations.literal: At thirteen years of age, King Zhuangxiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as King of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: At age thirteen, King Zhuangxiang died and Zheng succeeded him as King of Qin.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，秦地已并巴、蜀、漢中，越宛有郢，置南郡矣；

translations.literal: When this time, Qin territory already annexed Ba, Shu, Han middle, passed Wan had Ying, established south commandery;
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong; it extended past Wan to include Ying, and established Nan commandery;

sentences.zh: 北收上郡以東，有河東、太原、上黨郡；

translations.literal: North collected Shang commandery east, had Hedong, Taiyuan, Shangdang commanderies;
translations.idiomatic: To the north it had collected the lands east of Shang commandery, including Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies;

sentences.zh: 東至滎陽，滅二周，置三川郡。

translations.literal: To the east it reached Xingyang, destroyed the two Zhou states, and established Sanchuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: To the east, Qin reached Xingyang, destroyed the two Zhou states, and established Sanchuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 呂不韋為相，封十萬戶，號曰文信侯。

translations.literal: Lü Buwei served as chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Lord Wenxin.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Buwei became chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and was titled Lord Wenxin.

sentences.zh: 招致賓客游士，欲以并天下。

translations.literal: He recruited guests and wandering scholars, intending to unify the world.
translations.idiomatic: He recruited guests and wandering scholars with the aim of unifying the world.

sentences.zh: 李斯為舍人。

translations.literal: Li Si served as an attendant.
translations.idiomatic: Li Si served as his attendant.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁、王齮、麃公等為將軍。

translations.literal: Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others served as generals.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others served as generals.

sentences.zh: 王年少，初即位，委國事大臣。

translations.literal: The king was young and had just ascended the throne, so he entrusted state affairs to his ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The king was young and new to the throne, so he entrusted state affairs to his ministers.

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang was the son of King Zhuang Xiang of Qin. King Zhuang Xiang was a Qin hostage in Zhao. He saw Lü Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, and took her. She gave birth to Shi Huang. He was born in Handan in the first month of King Zhao of Qin's forty-eighth year. When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the Zhao surname. At age thirteen, King Zhuang Xiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as king of Qin. At this time, Qin territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed through Wan and had Ying, and established Nanguo commandery; To the north it collected east of Shang commandery, having Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies; To the east it reached Xingyang, extinguished the two Zhou, and established Sanchuan commandery. Lü Buwei became chancellor, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Lord Wenxin. He recruited guests and wandering scholars, desiring to annex the world. Li Si was his attendant. Meng Ao, Wang Qi, Bi Gong, and others were generals. The king was young and had just ascended the throne. He entrusted state affairs to the ministers.

sentences.zh: 晉陽反，元年，將軍蒙驁擊定之。

translations.literal: Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao attacked and pacified it.
translations.idiomatic: Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao attacked and brought it under control.

sentences.zh: 二年，麃公將卒攻卷，斬首三萬。

translations.literal: In the second year, Bi Gong led troops to attack Juan and beheaded thirty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, General Bi Gong attacked Juan with his troops and beheaded thirty thousand.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻韓，取十三城。

translations.literal: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and captured thirteen cities.

sentences.zh: 王齮死。

translations.literal: Wang Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Qi died.

sentences.zh: 十月，將軍蒙驁攻魏氏暢、有詭。

translations.literal: Tenth month, general Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang, You Gui.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Chang and Yougui of Wei.

sentences.zh: 歲大饑。

translations.literal: There was a great famine that year.
translations.idiomatic: There was a severe famine that year.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔暢、有詭。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they captured Chang and Yougui.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they captured Chang and Yougui.

sentences.zh: 三月，軍罷。

translations.literal: In the third month, the army was disbanded.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the army was disbanded.

sentences.zh: 秦質子歸自趙，趙太子出歸國。

translations.literal: Qin's hostage returned from Zhao, and Zhao's crown prince went out and returned to his state.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's hostage returned from Zhao, and Zhao's crown prince departed to return to his state.

sentences.zh: 十月庚寅，蝗蟲從東方來，蔽天。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, on Gengyin day, locusts came from the east and covered the sky.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month on the Gengyin day, locusts came from the east and blotted out the sky.

sentences.zh: 天下疫。

translations.literal: There was an epidemic throughout the world.
translations.idiomatic: There was an epidemic throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 百姓內粟千石，拜爵一級。

translations.literal: Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were granted nobility one rank higher.
translations.idiomatic: Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were granted nobility one rank higher.

sentences.zh: 五年，將軍驁攻魏，定酸棗、燕、虛、長平、雍丘、山陽城，皆拔之，取二十城。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang cities, captured them all, and took twenty cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, bringing Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang under control. He captured them all, taking twenty cities in total.

sentences.zh: 初置東郡。

translations.literal: Dong commandery was initially established.
translations.idiomatic: Dong commandery was established for the first time.

sentences.zh: 冬雷。

translations.literal: There was thunder in winter.
translations.idiomatic: There was thunder in winter.

sentences.zh: 六年，韓、魏、趙、衛、楚共擊秦，取壽陵。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu together attacked Qin and took Shouling.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu joined forces to attack Qin and captured Shouling.

sentences.zh: 秦出兵，五國兵罷。

translations.literal: Qin sent out troops, and the five states' armies disbanded.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent out troops, and the five states' armies withdrew.

sentences.zh: 拔衛，迫東郡，其君角率其支屬徙居野王，阻其山以保魏之河內。

translations.literal: Pulled Wei, pressed Dong commandery, its ruler Jiao led his branches relatives moved resided Ye Wang, blocked its mountains to preserve Wei's river inner.
translations.idiomatic: They captured Wei and pressed against Dong commandery. Its ruler Jiao led his clan and relatives to move and reside at Yewang, blocking the mountains to preserve Wei's Henan region.

sentences.zh: 七年，彗星先出東方，見北方，五月見西方。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was visible in the north, and appeared in the west in the fifth month.

sentences.zh: 將軍驁死。

translations.literal: General Ao died.
translations.idiomatic: General Ao died.

sentences.zh: 以攻龍、孤、慶都，還兵攻汲。

translations.literal: After attacking Long, Gu, and Qingdu, they turned their troops back to attack Ji.
translations.idiomatic: After attacking Long, Gu, and Qingdu, they turned their troops back to attack Ji.

sentences.zh: 彗星復見西方十六日。

translations.literal: The comet was seen again in the west for sixteen days.
translations.idiomatic: The comet reappeared in the west for sixteen days.

sentences.zh: 夏太后死。

translations.literal: Empress Dowager Xia died.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Xia died.

sentences.zh: 八年，王弟長安君成蟜將軍擊趙，反，死屯留，軍吏皆斬死，遷其民於臨洮。

translations.literal: Eighth year, king's younger brother Chang An Jun Cheng Juan general struck Zhao, rebelled, died Tun Liu, army officials all beheaded died, moved their people to Lin Tao.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, the king's younger brother Lord Chang'an Cheng Juan, serving as general, attacked Zhao but rebelled. He died at Tunliu, all the army officers were beheaded, and their people were moved to Lintao.

sentences.zh: 將軍壁死，卒屯留、蒲鶴反，戮其尸。

translations.literal: General Bi died, and the troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated.
translations.idiomatic: General Bi died, and the troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated.

sentences.zh: 河魚大上，輕車重馬東就食。

translations.literal: River fish ascended in great numbers, and light chariots and heavy horses went east to seek food.
translations.idiomatic: Great numbers of river fish swam upstream, and light chariots and heavy horses went east in search of food.

translations.literal: Jinyang rebelled. In the first year, General Meng Ao struck and pacified it. In the second year, Bi Gong led troops to attack Juan and beheaded thirty thousand. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities. Wang Qi died. In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Wei's Chang and Yougui. There was a great famine that year. In the fourth year, they pulled Chang and Yougui. In the third month, the army was dismissed. The Qin hostage returned from Zhao. The Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state. In the tenth month on Gengyin day, locusts came from the east, covering the sky. There was an epidemic throughout the world. Commoners who donated one thousand shi of grain were bestowed nobility one level. In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzhao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang cities. He pulled them all and took twenty cities. They initially established Dong commandery. There was thunder in winter. In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu together struck Qin and took Shouling. Qin sent out troops, and the five states' troops were dismissed. They pulled Wei and pressed Dong commandery. Its ruler Jiao led his branches and relatives to move and reside in Yewang, blocking the mountains to preserve Wei's Henei. In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west. General Ao died. They attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned troops to attack Ji. The comet was again seen in the west for sixteen days. Xia Taihou died. In the eighth year, the king's younger brother Lord Chang'an Cheng Juan led troops to strike Zhao, rebelled, died at Tunliu. All army officials were beheaded and died. Their people were moved to Lintao. General Bi died. Troops at Tunliu and Puhe rebelled. Their corpses were mutilated. River fish greatly ascended. Light chariots and heavy horses went east to seek food.

sentences.zh: 嫪毐封為長信侯。

translations.literal: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin.
translations.idiomatic: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin.

sentences.zh: 予之山陽地，令毐居之。

translations.literal: He was given Shanyang land and ordered to reside there.
translations.idiomatic: He was given Shanyang land and ordered to live there.

sentences.zh: 宮室車馬衣服苑囿馳獵恣毐。

translations.literal: Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, enclosures, galloping, and hunting—all were indulged for Ai.
translations.idiomatic: Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, parks, galloping, and hunting—all were provided without limit for Ai.

sentences.zh: 事無小大皆決於毐。

translations.literal: All matters, great or small, were decided by Ai.
translations.idiomatic: All matters, whether great or small, were decided by Ai.

sentences.zh: 又以河西太原郡更為毐國。

translations.literal: The Hexi and Taiyuan commanderies were again changed to become Ai's state.
translations.idiomatic: The Hexi and Taiyuan commanderies were once again changed to become Ai's domain.

sentences.zh: 九年，彗星見，或竟天。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, a comet appeared, sometimes crossing the entire sky.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, a comet appeared, sometimes spanning the entire sky.

sentences.zh: 攻魏垣、蒲陽。

translations.literal: They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puyang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puyang.

sentences.zh: 四月，上宿雍。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, the emperor lodged at Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, His Majesty lodged at Yong.

sentences.zh: 己酉，王冠，帶劍。

translations.literal: On Jiyou day, the king was crowned and belted with a sword.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiyou day, the king was crowned and girded with a sword.

sentences.zh: 長信侯毐作亂而覺，矯王御璽及太后璽以發縣卒及衛卒、官騎、戎翟君公、舍人，將欲攻蘄年宮為亂。

translations.literal: Lord Changxin Lao Ai plotted rebellion and was discovered. He falsified the king's imperial seal and the empress dowager's seal to mobilize county troops, guard troops, official riders, Rongdi nobles, and attendants, intending to attack the Qinian Palace in rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Changxin Lao Ai plotted rebellion and was discovered. He forged the king's imperial seal and the empress dowager's seal to mobilize county troops, guard troops, official cavalry, Rongdi nobles, and attendants, intending to attack the Qinian Palace in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 王知之，令相國昌平君、昌文君發卒攻毐。

translations.literal: The king learned of it and ordered the chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to send troops to attack Ai.
translations.idiomatic: The king learned of it and ordered Chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to dispatch troops to attack Ai.

sentences.zh: 戰咸陽，斬首數百，皆拜爵，及宦者皆在戰中，亦拜爵一級。

translations.literal: They fought at Xianyang, beheaded several hundred, and all were granted nobility ranks. Even the eunuchs who were in the battle were also granted one nobility rank.
translations.idiomatic: They fought at Xianyang and beheaded several hundred. All participants were granted nobility ranks, and even the eunuchs who took part in the battle were granted one nobility rank.

sentences.zh: 毐等敗走。

translations.literal: Ai and his followers were defeated and fled.
translations.idiomatic: Ai and his followers were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 即令國中：有生得毐，賜錢百萬；

translations.literal: Immediately ordered state middle: who alive captures Ai, grants money one million;
translations.idiomatic: He immediately ordered throughout the state: Whoever captures Ai alive will be granted one million cash;

sentences.zh: 殺之，五十萬。

translations.literal: whoever kills him, five hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Whoever kills him will receive five hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 盡得毐等。

translations.literal: They completely captured Ai and his followers.
translations.idiomatic: They completely captured Ai and his followers.

sentences.zh: 衛尉竭、內史肆、佐弋竭、中大夫令齊等二十人皆梟首。

translations.literal: Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi, and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi, and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles.

sentences.zh: 車裂以徇，滅其宗。

translations.literal: They were torn apart by chariots and displayed as a warning, and their clans were extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: They were torn apart by chariots as a public warning, and their clans were extinguished.

sentences.zh: 及其舍人，輕者為鬼薪。

translations.literal: As for their attendants, the lesser ones were made to gather firewood for the ghosts.
translations.idiomatic: As for their attendants, the lesser ones were sentenced to gather firewood for the ghosts.

sentences.zh: 及奪爵遷蜀四千餘家，家房陵。

translations.literal: They stripped them of nobility and moved over four thousand families to Shu, settling them at Fangling.
translations.idiomatic: They stripped the families of their nobility and relocated more than four thousand households to Shu, settling them at Fangling.

sentences.zh: （四）［是］月寒凍，有死者。

translations.literal: That month there was bitter cold, and some people died.
translations.idiomatic: That month brought bitter cold, and some people died.

sentences.zh: 楊端和攻衍氏。

translations.literal: Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi.

sentences.zh: 彗星見西方，又見北方，從斗以南八十日。

translations.literal: A comet appeared in the west, then again in the north, extending south from the Dipper for eighty days.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared in the west, then reappeared in the north, stretching southward from the Dipper for eighty days.

sentences.zh: 十年，相國呂不韋坐嫪毐免。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed due to his connection with Lao Ai.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed because of his involvement with Lao Ai.

sentences.zh: 桓齮為將軍。

translations.literal: Huan Yi became general.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Yi became a general.

sentences.zh: 齊、趙來置酒。

translations.literal: Qi and Zhao came and held a banquet.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Zhao came and held a banquet.

sentences.zh: 齊人茅焦說秦王曰：「秦方以天下為事，而大王有遷母太后之名，恐諸侯聞之，由此倍秦也。」

translations.literal: Qi person Mao Jiao persuaded Qin king said: 'Qin just with world as matter, yet great king has moved mother Tai Hou name, fear feudal lords hear it, thereby double Qin also.'
translations.idiomatic: The man from Qi, Mao Jiao, persuaded the King of Qin, saying, 'Qin is currently engaged with matters of the world, yet Your Majesty has the reputation of moving away your mother the Empress Dowager. I fear that if the feudal lords hear of this, they will thereby turn against Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦王乃迎太后於雍而入咸陽，復居甘泉宮。

translations.literal: The King of Qin then welcomed the Empress Dowager at Yong and brought her into Xianyang, where she again resided in the Ganquan Palace.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin then went to Yong to welcome the Empress Dowager and brought her back to Xianyang, where she once again resided in the Ganquan Palace.

translations.literal: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Lord Changxin. He was given Shanyang land and ordered to reside there. Palaces, chariots, horses, clothes, gardens, enclosures, galloping, and hunting - Ai was indulged in all these. All matters, whether small or great, were decided by Ai. The Taiyuan commandery west of the river was again changed to Ai's state. In the ninth year, a comet was seen, or it crossed the sky. They attacked Wei's Yuan and Puying. In the fourth month, the emperor lodged at Yong. On Jiyou day, the king was crowned and belted with a sword. Lord Changxin Ai made rebellion and it was discovered. He falsified the king's imperial seal and the queen mother's seal to send county troops, guard troops, official riders, Rongdi lords and nobles, and attendants. He intended to attack the Qinian palace and cause rebellion. The king knew it and ordered Chancellor Lord Changping and Lord Changwen to send troops to attack Ai. They fought at Xianyang and beheaded several hundred. All were bestowed nobility, and the eunuchs who were in the battle were also bestowed nobility one level. Ai and the others were defeated and fled. He immediately ordered throughout the state: whoever captures Ai alive will be granted one million cash; whoever kills him, five hundred thousand. They completely obtained Ai and the others. Wei Wei Jie, Nei Shi Si, Zuo Yi Jie, Zhong Da Fu Ling Qi and twenty others all had their heads displayed on poles. They were torn apart by carts for display and their clans extinguished. And their attendants - the lighter ones became ghost firewood workers. And nobility was stripped and more than four thousand families were moved to Shu, each family to Fangling. This month had severe cold and freezing, with some dying. Yang Duan He attacked Yanshi. A comet was seen in the west, and again in the north, from Dou southward for eighty days. In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed due to Lao Ai. Huan Yi became general. Qi and Zhao came to set up a wine feast. The Qi man Mao Jiao persuaded the Qin king saying: 'Qin is just making the world its business, yet Your Majesty has the name of having moved Mother Taihou. I fear the feudal lords will hear of it and thereby turn against Qin.' The Qin king then welcomed the Taihou at Yong and entered Xianyang, again residing in the Ganquan palace.

sentences.zh: 大索，逐客，李斯上書說，乃止逐客令。

translations.literal: There was a great search and expulsion of guests, but Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the order to expel guests was stopped.
translations.idiomatic: A great search was conducted and guests were expelled, but Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the order to expel guests was rescinded.

sentences.zh: 李斯因說秦王，請先取韓以恐他國，於是使斯下韓。

translations.literal: Li Si therefore persuaded the King of Qin, requesting that they first take Han to frighten the other states. Thereupon he had Li Si go to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Li Si therefore persuaded the King of Qin, requesting that they first take Han to intimidate the other states. The king then sent Li Si to Han.

sentences.zh: 韓王患之。

translations.literal: The King of Han was troubled by this.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han was alarmed by this.

sentences.zh: 與韓非謀弱秦。

translations.literal: He plotted with Han Fei to weaken Qin.
translations.idiomatic: He plotted with Han Fei to weaken Qin.

sentences.zh: 大梁人尉繚來，說秦王曰：「以秦之彊，諸侯譬如郡縣之君，臣但恐諸侯合從，翕而出不意，此乃智伯、夫差、湣王之所以亡也。

translations.literal: Da Liang person Wei Liao came, persuaded Qin king said: 'With Qin's strength, feudal lords like commandery county rulers, minister only fears feudal lords allied together, suddenly come out unexpectedly, this namely Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, Min Wang reason perished.'
translations.idiomatic: The man from Daliang, Wei Liao, came and persuaded the King of Qin, saying, 'With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like the rulers of commanderies and counties. Your minister only fears that the feudal lords will ally together and suddenly come out unexpectedly—this is how Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, and King Min perished.'

sentences.zh: 願大王毋愛財物，賂其豪臣，以亂其謀，不過亡三十萬金，則諸侯可盡。」

translations.literal: Wish great king not love wealth objects, bribe their powerful ministers, to disrupt their plans, no more lose three hundred thousand gold, then feudal lords can exhaust.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Majesty would not begrudge wealth and valuables, but bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans. It would cost no more than three hundred thousand in gold, and then the feudal lords could be exhausted.'

sentences.zh: 秦王從其計，見尉繚亢禮，衣服食飲與繚同。

translations.literal: The King of Qin followed his plan. He saw Wei Liao with proud ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin followed his plan. He received Wei Liao with great ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's.

sentences.zh: 繚曰：「秦王為人，蜂準，長目，摯鳥膺，豺聲，少恩而虎狼心，居約易出人下，得志亦輕食人。

translations.literal: Liao said: 'Qin king as person, bee nose, long eyes, determined bird breast, jackal voice, little kindness but tiger wolf heart, reside poverty easily comes out person below, obtains will also lightly eats person.
translations.idiomatic: Liao said, 'The King of Qin as a person has a nose like a bee's sting, long eyes, determined like a bird's breast, a jackal's voice, little kindness but a tiger and wolf heart. When in straitened circumstances he easily puts himself below others; when he obtains his will, he also lightly eats people.'

sentences.zh: 我布衣，然見我常身自下我。

translations.literal: I am in commoner's clothes, yet when he sees me he often lowers his body himself beneath me.
translations.idiomatic: I wear commoner's clothes, yet when he sees me he always bows his body beneath mine.

sentences.zh: 誠使秦王得志於天下，天下皆為虜矣。

translations.literal: Truly make Qin king obtain will in world, world all become captives.'
translations.idiomatic: If the King of Qin truly obtains his will in the world, the world will all become his captives.'

sentences.zh: 不可與久游。」

translations.literal: Cannot with long travel.'
translations.idiomatic: One cannot travel with him for long.'

sentences.zh: 乃亡去。

translations.literal: So he fled away.
translations.idiomatic: So he fled.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺，固止，以為秦國尉，卒用其計策。

translations.literal: The King of Qin became aware and firmly stopped him, making him Commandant of Qin, and in the end used his strategies.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin became aware and firmly detained him, appointing him Commandant of Qin, and eventually adopted his strategies.

sentences.zh: 而李斯用事。

translations.literal: And Li Si handled affairs.
translations.idiomatic: And Li Si took charge of affairs.

translations.literal: A great search was conducted and guests were expelled. Li Si presented a memorial persuading the king, and the expel guests command was stopped. Li Si therefore persuaded the Qin king, requesting to first take Han to frighten the other states. Thereupon he had Si go down to Han. The Han king was worried about it. With Han Fei he plotted to weaken Qin. The Daliang man Wei Liao came and persuaded the Qin king saying: 'With Qin's strength, the feudal lords are like rulers of commanderies and counties. I only fear that the feudal lords will ally together and suddenly strike unexpectedly. This is why Zhi Bo, Fu Cha, and King Min perished.' I wish Your Majesty not to love wealth and objects, but to bribe their powerful ministers to disrupt their plans. It will cost no more than three hundred thousand gold, and then the feudal lords can be exhausted.' The Qin king followed his plan. He saw Wei Liao with proud ceremony, and his clothes, food, and drink were the same as Liao's. Liao said: 'The Qin king as a person has a bee-like nose, long eyes, a determined bird-like breast, jackal voice, little kindness but a tiger-wolf heart. When in poverty he easily puts himself below others, but when he obtains his will he also lightly eats people.' I am in common clothes, yet when he sees me he often lowers himself below me.' Truly, if the Qin king obtains his will in the world, the world will all become captives.' One cannot travel with him for long.' He then fled away. The Qin king became aware and firmly stopped him. He made him the Wei of Qin state and finally used his strategies. And Li Si handled affairs.

sentences.zh: 十一年，王翦、桓齮、楊端和攻鄴，取九城。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and took nine cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and captured nine cities.

sentences.zh: 王翦攻閼與、橑楊，皆并為一軍。

translations.literal: Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, and all were combined into one army.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, and all were combined into one army.

sentences.zh: 翦將十八日，軍歸斗食以下，什推二人從軍取鄴安陽，桓齮將。

translations.literal: Jian was general for eighteen days. The army returned those of dou shi rank and below. One out of every ten pushed two persons to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang, with Huan Yi as general.
translations.idiomatic: Jian served as general for eighteen days. The army dismissed those of dou shi rank and below. One out of every ten pressed two persons to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang, with Huan Yi as general.

sentences.zh: 十二年，文信侯不韋死，竊葬。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Bu Wei died and was buried in secret.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Lü Buwei died and was buried in secret.

sentences.zh: 其舍人臨者，晉人也逐出之；

translations.literal: His attendants attending ones, Jin people also drove out them;
translations.idiomatic: His attendants who attended the funeral, including Jin people, were also driven out;

sentences.zh: 秦人六百石以上奪爵，遷；

translations.literal: Qin people six hundred shi above stripped nobility, moved;
translations.idiomatic: Qin people of six hundred shi rank and above were stripped of nobility and moved;

sentences.zh: 五百石以下不臨，遷，勿奪爵。

translations.literal: Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were moved but not stripped of nobility.
translations.idiomatic: Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were relocated but not stripped of their nobility.

sentences.zh: 自今以來，操國事不道如嫪毐、不韋者籍其門，視此。

translations.literal: From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Bu Wei will have their gates registered—take this as a warning.
translations.idiomatic: From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Lü Buwei will have their households registered—take this as a warning.

sentences.zh: 秋，復嫪毐舍人遷蜀者。

translations.literal: In autumn, the attendants of Lao Ai who had been moved to Shu were moved again.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, the attendants of Lao Ai who had been relocated to Shu were moved again.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，天下大旱，六月至八月乃雨。

translations.literal: At this time, there was a great drought throughout the world. It did not rain from the sixth month until the eighth month.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, a great drought afflicted the empire. It did not rain from the sixth month until the eighth month.

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wang Jian, Huan Yi, and Yang Duan He attacked Ye and took nine cities. Wang Jian attacked Eyu and Laoyang, combining them all as one army. Jian was general for eighteen days. The army returned with those of dou shi rank and below. Every shi had two pushed to follow the army and take Ye and Anyang. Huan Yi was general. In the twelfth year, Lord Wenxin Buwei died and was secretly buried. His attendants who attended - the Jin people were also driven out; Qin people of six hundred shi rank and above had their nobility stripped and were moved; Those of five hundred shi rank and below who did not attend were moved but not stripped of nobility. From now on, those who handle state affairs improperly like Lao Ai and Buwei will have their gates registered. Regard this. In autumn, those who were Lao Ai's attendants and moved to Shu were again moved. At this time, there was a great drought throughout the world. It rained from the sixth month to the eighth month.

sentences.zh: 十三年，桓齮攻趙平陽，殺趙將扈輒，斬首十萬。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed the Zhao general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed the Zhao general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 王之河南。

translations.literal: The king went to Henan.
translations.idiomatic: The king went to Henan.

sentences.zh: 正月，彗星見東方。

translations.literal: In the first month, a comet appeared in the east.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, a comet appeared in the east.

sentences.zh: 十月，桓齮攻趙。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao.

sentences.zh: 十四年，攻趙軍於平陽，取宜安，破之，殺其將軍。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, took Yian, broke it, and killed their general.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, captured Yian, routed it, and killed its general.

sentences.zh: 桓齮定平陽、武城。

translations.literal: Huan Yi pacified Pingyang and Wucheng.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Yi brought Pingyang and Wucheng under control.

sentences.zh: 韓非使秦，秦用李斯謀，留非，非死雲陽。

translations.literal: Han Fei was sent to Qin. Qin used Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died at Yunyang.
translations.idiomatic: Han Fei was sent as an envoy to Qin. Qin followed Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died at Yunyang.

sentences.zh: 韓王請為臣。

translations.literal: The King of Han requested to become a minister.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han requested to become a vassal.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Huan Yi attacked Zhao's Pingyang, killed Zhao's general Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand. The king went to Henan. In the first month, a comet was seen in the east. In the tenth month, Huan Yi attacked Zhao. In the fourteenth year, they attacked the Zhao army at Pingyang, took Yian, broke it, and killed their general. Huan Yi pacified Pingyang and Wucheng. Han Fei was sent to Qin. Qin used Li Si's plan, detained Fei, and Fei died in Yunyang. The Han king requested to become a minister.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大興兵，一軍至鄴，一軍至太原，取狼孟。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they greatly raised troops—one army went to Ye, one army to Taiyuan, and they took Langmeng.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they mobilized a large army—one force went to Ye, another to Taiyuan—and they captured Langmeng.

sentences.zh: 地動。

translations.literal: There was an earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: The earth shook.

sentences.zh: 十六年九月，發卒受地韓南陽假守騰。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, ninth month, they sent troops to receive the land of Han's Nanyang from the acting governor Teng.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, ninth month, they dispatched troops to receive Han's Nanyang lands from the acting governor Teng.

sentences.zh: 初令男子書年。

translations.literal: For the first time, they ordered men to register their ages.
translations.idiomatic: For the first time, they ordered men to register their ages.

sentences.zh: 魏獻地於秦。

translations.literal: Wei offered land to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Wei ceded land to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦置麗邑。

translations.literal: Qin established Liyi.
translations.idiomatic: Qin established Liyi.

sentences.zh: 十七年，內史騰攻韓，得韓王安，盡納其地，以其地為郡，命曰潁川。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, the Chamberlain for the Capital Teng attacked Han, captured King An of Han, and completely took his lands, making them into a commandery named Yingchuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Chamberlain for the Capital Teng attacked Han, captured King An of Han, and took all his lands, establishing them as a commandery named Yingchuan.

sentences.zh: 地動。

translations.literal: There was an earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: The earth shook.

sentences.zh: 華陽太后卒。

translations.literal: Empress Dowager Huayang died.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Huayang died.

sentences.zh: 民大饑。

translations.literal: There was a great famine among the people.
translations.idiomatic: A severe famine afflicted the people.

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, troops were greatly raised. One army went to Ye, one army to Taiyuan, and took Langmeng. There was an earthquake. In the ninth month of the sixteenth year, troops were sent to receive land from Han's Nanyang. Acting guard Teng. Males were initially ordered to register their age. Wei offered land to Qin. Qin established Liyi. In the seventeenth year, Nei Shi Teng attacked Han, got Han King An, and completely took his land. His land was made into a commandery named Yingchuan. There was an earthquake. Hua Yang Taihou died. The people suffered a great famine.

sentences.zh: 十八年，大興兵攻趙，王翦將上地，下井陘，端和將河內，羌瘣伐趙，端和圍邯鄲城。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, they greatly raised troops to attack Zhao. Wang Jian commanded the upper lands and descended through Jingxing. Duan He commanded Henan. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Duan He surrounded Handan city.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, they mobilized a massive army to attack Zhao. Wang Jian commanded the highlands and descended through Jingxing Pass. Yang Duan He commanded Henan. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Yang Duan He besieged Handan city.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王翦、羌瘣盡定取趙地東陽，得趙王。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely pacified and took the Dongyang lands of Zhao, and captured the King of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely subdued and took Zhao's Dongyang lands, capturing the King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 引兵欲攻燕，屯中山。

translations.literal: They led troops intending to attack Yan and stationed them at Zhongshan.
translations.idiomatic: They led their troops intending to attack Yan and stationed them at Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 秦王之邯鄲，諸嘗與王生趙時母家有仇怨，皆阬之。

translations.literal: The King of Qin went to Handan. All those who had once borne grudges against the king's mother's family from the time he was born in Zhao were all thrown into pits.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin went to Handan. All those who had once borne grudges against the king's mother's family from the time of his birth in Zhao were thrown into pits.

sentences.zh: 秦王還，從太原、上郡歸。

translations.literal: The King of Qin returned, coming back through Taiyuan and Shang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin returned, passing through Taiyuan and Shang commandery.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝母太后崩。

translations.literal: The First Emperor's mother, the Empress Dowager, passed away.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor's mother, the Empress Dowager, passed away.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉率其宗數百人之代，自立為代王，東與燕合兵，軍上谷。

translations.literal: Prince Jia of Zhao led several hundred members of his clan to Dai, established himself as King of Dai, allied with Yan to the east, and stationed troops at Shanggu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao's Prince Jia led several hundred clansmen to Dai, proclaimed himself King of Dai, allied with Yan to the east, and stationed troops at Shanggu.

sentences.zh: 大饑。

translations.literal: There was a great famine.
translations.idiomatic: A severe famine occurred.

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, troops were greatly raised to attack Zhao. Wang Jian was general of the upper lands and descended through Jingxing. Duan He was general of Henei. Qiang Wei attacked Zhao, and Duan He surrounded Handan city. In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian and Qiang Wei completely pacified and took Zhao's Dongyang land and got the Zhao king. They led troops desiring to attack Yan and stationed at Zhongshan. The Qin king went to Handan. Those who once had enmities with the king's mother's family from when he was born in Zhao were all pit-killed. The Qin king returned, going back through Taiyuan and Shang commandery. Shi Huangdi's mother Taihou collapsed. Zhao Gong Zi Jia led several hundred of his clansmen to Dai, established himself as Dai king, combined troops with Yan to the east, and stationed at Shanggu. There was a great famine.

sentences.zh: 二十年，燕太子丹患秦兵至國，恐，使荊軻刺秦王。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Crown Prince Dan of Yan, worried that Qin troops would reach his state, in fear sent Jing Ke to assassinate the King of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Yan's Crown Prince Dan, fearing that Qin troops would invade his state, sent Jing Ke to assassinate the King of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺之，體解軻以徇，而使王翦、辛勝攻燕。

translations.literal: The King of Qin became aware of it, had Jing Ke dismembered and displayed as a warning, and sent Wang Jian and Xin Sheng to attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin learned of it, had Jing Ke dismembered and displayed as a warning, and sent Wang Jian and Xin Sheng to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕、代發兵擊秦軍，秦軍破燕易水之西。

translations.literal: Yan and Dai sent troops to attack the Qin army, and the Qin army defeated Yan west of the Yi River.
translations.idiomatic: Yan and Dai dispatched troops to attack the Qin army, but the Qin army defeated Yan west of the Yi River.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，王賁攻（薊）［荊］。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.

sentences.zh: 乃益發卒詣王翦軍，遂破燕太子軍，取燕薊城，得太子丹之首。

translations.literal: Then additionally sent troops went to Wang Jian army, then broke Yan crown prince army, took Yan Ji city, got crown prince Dan's head.
translations.idiomatic: They then additionally sent troops to join Wang Jian's army, then broke the Yan crown prince's army, took Yan's Ji city, and obtained Crown Prince Dan's head.

sentences.zh: 燕王東收遼東而王之。

translations.literal: The King of Yan gathered Liaodong to the east and ruled it as king.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yan gathered Liaodong to the east and ruled there as king.

sentences.zh: 王翦謝病老歸。

translations.literal: Wang Jian declined on grounds of illness and old age, and returned home.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian declined on grounds of illness and old age, and returned home.

sentences.zh: 新鄭反。

translations.literal: Xinzheng rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Xinzheng rebelled.

sentences.zh: 昌平君徙於郢。

translations.literal: Lord Changping moved to Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Changping relocated to Ying.

sentences.zh: 大雨雪，深二尺五寸。

translations.literal: There was heavy snowfall, reaching a depth of two chi and five cun.
translations.idiomatic: Heavy snow fell, reaching a depth of two chi and five cun.

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Yan Crown Prince Dan, worried that Qin troops would reach his state, feared, and had Jing Ke stab the Qin king. The Qin king became aware of it, had Ke bodily dismembered for display, and had Wang Jian and Xin Sheng attack Yan. Yan and Dai sent troops to strike the Qin army. The Qin army broke Yan west of the Yishui. In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing. They then additionally sent troops to Wang Jian's army, broke the Yan crown prince's army, took Yan's Ji city, and got Crown Prince Dan's head. The Yan king collected Liaodong to the east and became king there. Wang Jian declined due to illness and old age and returned. Xinzheng rebelled. Lord Changping moved to Ying. There was a great snowfall, two chi and five cun deep.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，王賁攻魏，引河溝灌大梁，大梁城壞，其王請降，盡取其地。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, diverted river channels to flood Daliang. The city walls collapsed, and its king requested surrender. They completely took all its lands.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, diverted river channels to flood Daliang. The city's walls collapsed, its king surrendered, and Qin took all its territory.

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, led river channels to irrigate Daliang, Daliang's city was damaged, its king requested surrender, and they completely took its land.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，秦王復召王翦，彊起之，使將擊荊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the King of Qin again summoned Wang Jian, forced him out of retirement, and made him general to attack Jing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, the King of Qin summoned Wang Jian again, forcibly recalled him from retirement, and made him general to attack Jing.

sentences.zh: 取陳以南至平輿，虜荊王。

translations.literal: They took the lands from Chen southward to Pingyu and captured the King of Jing.
translations.idiomatic: They took territory from Chen southward to Pingyu and captured the King of Jing.

sentences.zh: 秦王游至郢陳。

translations.literal: The King of Qin toured to Ying and Chen.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin toured to Ying and Chen.

sentences.zh: 荊將項燕立昌平君為荊王，反秦於淮南。

translations.literal: The Jing general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as King of Jing and rebelled against Qin in the Huai south region.
translations.idiomatic: Jing general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as King of Jing and rebelled against Qin south of the Huai River.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，王翦、蒙武攻荊，破荊軍，昌平君死，項燕遂自殺。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke the Jing army. Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, defeated the Jing army. Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the Qin king again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly raised him, and made him general to strike Jing. They took from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the Jing king. The Qin king toured to Yingchen. Jing's general Xiang Yan established Lord Changping as Jing king and rebelled against Qin in Huainan. In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, broke the Jing army, Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，大興兵，使王賁將，攻燕遼東，得燕王喜。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, they greatly raised troops, made Wang Ben the general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and captured King Xi of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, they mobilized a large army, appointed Wang Ben as general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and captured King Xi of Yan.

sentences.zh: 還攻代，虜代王嘉。

translations.literal: They then attacked Dai and captured King Jia of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: They then attacked Dai and captured King Jia of Dai.

sentences.zh: 王翦遂定荊江南地；

translations.literal: Wang Jian then pacified Jing Jiang south land;
translations.idiomatic: Wang Jian then pacified the Jing lands south of the Jiang;

sentences.zh: 降越君，置會稽郡。

translations.literal: he subjugated the Lord of Yue and established Kuaiji commandery.
translations.idiomatic: He subjugated the Lord of Yue and established Kuaiji commandery.

sentences.zh: 五月，天下大酺。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, there was a great celebration throughout the world.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was a great celebration throughout the empire.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, troops were greatly raised, Wang Ben was made general, attacked Yan's Liaodong, and got Yan King Xi. They returned and attacked Dai, capturing Dai King Jia. Wang Jian then pacified Jing's land south of the Jiang; They surrendered the Yue jun and established Huiji commandery. In the fifth month, there was a great fu throughout the world.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊王建與其相後勝發兵守其西界，不通秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, King Jian of Qi, together with his chancellor Hou Sheng, sent troops to guard his western border and refused to communicate with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi's King Jian, together with his chancellor Hou Sheng, dispatched troops to guard his western border and refused contact with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使將軍王賁從燕南攻齊，得齊王建。

translations.literal: Qin sent General Wang Ben to attack Qi from south of Yan and captured King Jian of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent General Wang Ben to attack Qi from south of Yan and captured King Jian of Qi.

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi King Jian and his chancellor Hou Sheng sent troops to guard his western border and did not connect with Qin. Qin had General Wang Ben attack Qi from south of Yan and got Qi King Jian.

sentences.zh: 秦王初并天下，令丞相、御史曰：「異日韓王納地效璽，請為藩臣，已而倍約，與趙、魏合從畔秦，故興兵誅之，虜其王。

translations.literal: Qin king initially united world, commanded chancellor, imperial secretary said: 'Different day Han king entered land presented seal, requested to be fief minister, already then doubled agreement, with Zhao, Wei allied together rebelled Qin, therefore raised troops executed them, captured their king.
translations.idiomatic: When the King of Qin first unified the world, he commanded the chancellor and imperial secretary, saying, 'Previously the King of Han submitted his lands and presented his seal, requesting to become a vassal minister. But then he broke the agreement and allied with Zhao and Wei in rebellion against Qin, so I raised troops to execute them and captured their king.'

sentences.zh: 寡人以為善，庶幾息兵革。

translations.literal: I considered this good, perhaps it would bring an end to warfare.
translations.idiomatic: I considered this good, perhaps it would bring an end to warfare.

sentences.zh: 趙王使其相李牧來約盟，故歸其質子。

translations.literal: The King of Zhao sent his chancellor Li Mu to form an alliance, so I returned their hostage prince.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Zhao sent his chancellor Li Mu to form an alliance, so I returned their hostage prince.

sentences.zh: 已而倍盟，反我太原，故興兵誅之，得其王。

translations.literal: But then they broke the alliance and rebelled against our Taiyuan, so I raised troops to execute them and captured their king.
translations.idiomatic: But then they broke the alliance and rebelled against our Taiyuan, so I raised troops to punish them and captured their king.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉乃自立為代王，故舉兵擊滅之。

translations.literal: Prince Jia of Zhao then established himself as King of Dai, so I raised troops to attack and extinguish them.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao's Prince Jia then proclaimed himself King of Dai, so I raised troops to attack and destroy them.

sentences.zh: 魏王始約服入秦，已而與韓、趙謀襲秦，秦兵吏誅，遂破之。

translations.literal: The King of Wei initially agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to attack Qin. Our troops and officials executed them, and we broke their state.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei initially agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to attack Qin. Our troops and officials executed them and destroyed their state.

sentences.zh: 荊王獻青陽以西，已而畔約，擊我南郡，故發兵誅，得其王，遂定其荊地。

translations.literal: The King of Jing offered the lands west of Qingyang, but then broke the agreement and attacked our Nang commandery, so I sent troops to execute them, captured their king, and pacified their Jing lands.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Jing offered the lands west of Qingyang, but then broke the agreement and attacked our Nan commandery. So I sent troops to punish them, captured their king, and pacified their Jing lands.

sentences.zh: 燕王昏亂，其太子丹乃陰令荊軻為賊，兵吏誅，滅其國。

translations.literal: The King of Yan was muddled and chaotic; his Crown Prince Dan secretly ordered Jing Ke to act as an assassin. Our troops and officials executed them and extinguished their state.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yan was muddled and chaotic; his Crown Prince Dan secretly ordered Jing Ke to act as an assassin. Our troops and officials executed them and destroyed their state.

sentences.zh: 齊王用后勝計，絕秦使，欲為亂，兵吏誅，虜其王，平齊地。

translations.literal: The King of Qi used Hou Sheng's plan to cut off Qin envoys and wished to rebel. Our troops and officials executed them, captured their king, and pacified the Qi lands.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi followed Hou Sheng's plan to cut off Qin envoys and wished to rebel. Our troops and officials executed them, captured their king, and pacified the Qi lands.

sentences.zh: 寡人以眇眇之身，興兵誅暴亂，賴宗廟之靈，六王咸伏其辜，天下大定。

translations.literal: With my insignificant person, I raised troops to execute the violent and chaotic. Relying on the spirit of our ancestral temples, the six kings all submitted to their guilt, and the world is greatly settled.
translations.idiomatic: With my humble person, I raised troops to execute the violent and chaotic. Relying on the spirit of our ancestral temples, the six kings all submitted to their guilt, and the world is greatly pacified.

sentences.zh: 今名號不更，無以稱成功，傳後世。

translations.literal: Now if the name and title are not changed, there is no way to match the success and transmit it to later generations.
translations.idiomatic: Now if the name and title are not changed, there is no way to match our success and transmit it to later generations.

sentences.zh: 其議帝號。」

translations.literal: Its discuss emperor title.'
translations.idiomatic: Discuss the emperor title.'

sentences.zh: 丞相綰、御史大夫劫、廷尉斯等皆曰：「昔者五帝地方千里，其外侯服夷服諸侯或朝或否，天子不能制。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wan, Imperial Secretary Dai Jie, Court Judge Si etc. all said: 'Former five emperors territory thousand li, their outside hou fu yi fu feudal lords some court some not, Son of Heaven could not control.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Wan, Imperial Secretary Jie, Court Judge Si, and others all said, 'In former times, the Five Emperors' territories were only a thousand li square. Beyond that, the hou fu and yi fu feudal lords would sometimes come to court and sometimes not; the Son of Heaven could not control them.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下興義兵，誅殘賊，平定天下，海內為郡縣，法令由一統，自上古以來未嘗有，五帝所不及。

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty has raised righteous troops, executed remnant bandits, pacified and settled the world. Within the seas it is all commanderies and counties, laws and commands come from one unification. From high antiquity until now there has never been such a thing; the Five Emperors did not reach this.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty has raised righteous troops, executed remnant bandits, and pacified the world. Within the seas it is all commanderies and counties, laws and commands come from one unification. From high antiquity until now there has never been such a thing; even the Five Emperors did not achieve this.

sentences.zh: 臣等謹與博士議曰：『古有天皇，有地皇，有泰皇，泰皇最貴。』

translations.literal: Ministers etc. respectfully with scholars discussed said: 'Ancient had heaven emperor, had earth emperor, had great emperor, great emperor most noble.'
translations.idiomatic: We ministers respectfully discussed with the scholars and said, 'In ancient times there was the Heaven Emperor, the Earth Emperor, and the Great Emperor. The Great Emperor was the most noble.'

sentences.zh: 臣等昧死上尊號，王為『泰皇』。

translations.literal: Ministers etc. blind death present honored title, king as 'great emperor'.
translations.idiomatic: We ministers, risking death, present the honored title: the king as 'Great Emperor.'

sentences.zh: 命為『制』，令為『詔』，天子自稱曰『朕』。」

translations.literal: Commands as 'decrees', orders as 'edicts', Son of Heaven self calls 'I'.'
translations.idiomatic: Commands are to be called 'decrees,' orders are to be called 'edicts,' and the Son of Heaven is to refer to himself as 'I.''

sentences.zh: 王曰：「去『泰』，著『皇』，采上古『帝』位號，號曰『皇帝』。

translations.literal: King said: 'Remove 'great', attach 'emperor', adopt high ancient 'emperor' position title, titled 'emperor'.
translations.idiomatic: The king said, 'Remove "great," attach "emperor." Adopt the high ancient "emperor" position title, and be titled "Emperor."'

sentences.zh: 他如議。」

translations.literal: Other as discussed.'
translations.idiomatic: For the rest, follow the discussion.'

sentences.zh: 制曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Decree said: 'Acceptable.'
translations.idiomatic: The decree said, 'Acceptable.'

sentences.zh: 追尊莊襄王為太上皇。

translations.literal: King Zhuangxiang was retroactively honored as the Supreme Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuangxiang was retroactively honored as the Supreme Emperor.

sentences.zh: 制曰：「朕聞太古有號毋謚，中古有號，死而以行為謐。

translations.literal: Decree said: 'I heard high ancient had titles no posthumous names, middle ancient had titles, died and with conduct as posthumous names.
translations.idiomatic: The decree said, 'I have heard that in high antiquity there were titles but no posthumous names. In middle antiquity there were titles, and after death they took conduct as posthumous names.'

sentences.zh: 如此，則子議父，臣議君也，甚無謂，朕弗取焉。

translations.literal: If it is like this, then sons would discuss fathers, ministers would discuss rulers. It is very meaningless; I will not take them.'
translations.idiomatic: If it is like this, then sons would discuss fathers, ministers would discuss rulers. It is very meaningless; I will not accept them.

sentences.zh: 自今已來，除謚法。

translations.literal: From now on, abolish the posthumous naming method.
translations.idiomatic: From now on, abolish the posthumous naming system.

sentences.zh: 朕為始皇帝。

translations.literal: I am the First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: I am the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 後世以計數，二世三世至于萬世，傳之無窮。」

translations.literal: Later generations by counting, second generation third generation until ten thousand generations, transmit endlessly.'
translations.idiomatic: Later generations will count them: the Second Generation, Third Generation, until ten thousand generations, transmitting it endlessly.'

Therefore we raised troops and executed them, capturing their king. I considered it good, perhaps to cease weapons and armor.' The Zhao king had his chancellor Li Mu come to ally and covenant, therefore we returned their hostage son. But then they doubled the covenant and rebelled against our Taiyuan. The Wei king initially agreed to submit and enter Qin, but then plotted with Han and Zhao to raid Qin. Qin's troops and officials executed them, then broke them. The Jing king offered west of Qingyang, but then rebelled against the agreement and struck our Nanguo commandery. Therefore we sent troops and executed them, got their king, and then pacified their Jing land. The Yan king was muddled and chaotic. His crown prince Dan secretly ordered Jing Ke to be a bandit. Our troops and officials executed them and extinguished their state. The Qi king used Hou Sheng's plan, cut off Qin envoys, and wished for rebellion. sentences.zh: 始皇推終始五德之傳，以為周得火德，秦代周德，從所不勝。

translations.literal: The First Emperor traced the transmission of the beginning and end of the Five Virtues, believing that Zhou received the fire virtue. Qin replaces Zhou's virtue, following what does not overcome it.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor traced the transmission of the Five Virtues from beginning to end, believing that Zhou received the fire virtue. Qin replaces Zhou's virtue, following what overcomes it.

sentences.zh: 方今水德之始，改年始，朝賀皆自十月朔。

translations.literal: Just now is the beginning of the water virtue. Change the beginning of the year; court congratulations all begin from the first day of the tenth month.
translations.idiomatic: Just now is the beginning of the water virtue. Change the beginning of the year; all court congratulations begin from the first day of the tenth month.

sentences.zh: 衣服旄旌節旗皆上黑。

translations.literal: Clothes, yak tails, banners, staffs, and flags all have black on top.
translations.idiomatic: Clothes, yak-tail banners, staffs, and flags all have black on top.

sentences.zh: 數以六為紀，符、法冠皆六寸，而輿六尺，六尺為步，乘六馬。

translations.literal: Numbers take six as the record. Tallies and law caps are all six inches. The carriage is six chi, six chi is a pace, and ride six horses.
translations.idiomatic: Numbers take six as the standard. Tallies and law caps are all six inches. The carriage is six chi, six chi equals a pace, and ride six horses.

sentences.zh: 更名河曰德水，以為水德之始。

translations.literal: Change the name of the river to Virtue Water, to be the beginning of the water virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Change the name of the Yellow River to Virtue Water, as the beginning of the water virtue.

sentences.zh: 剛毅戾深，事皆決於法，刻削毋仁恩和義，然後合五德之數。

translations.literal: Be firm, resolute, fierce, and deep. Matters are all decided by law, harsh and strict without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness. Only then does it match the number of the Five Virtues.
translations.idiomatic: Be firm, resolute, fierce, and profound. All matters are decided by law—harsh and strict without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness. Only then does it match the number of the Five Virtues.

sentences.zh: 於是急法，久者不赦。

translations.literal: Thereupon the laws were made urgent; long-standing cases were not pardoned.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the laws were made strict; long-standing cases were not pardoned.

Qin replaces Zhou's virtue, following what overcomes it. Just now is the beginning of the water virtue. Change the year beginning, and all court congratulations shall be from the first day of the tenth month. Clothes, yak tails, banners, staffs, and flags shall all be topped with black. Numbers shall use six as the record. Tallies and law caps shall all be six inches, the carriage six chi, six chi as a pace, and ride six horses. Be harsh and strict without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness. Only then will it match the Five Virtues number. Thereupon make the law urgent. Long-standing cases shall not be pardoned.

sentences.zh: 丞相綰等言：「諸侯初破，燕、齊、荊地遠，不為置王，毋以填之。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wan etc. spoke: 'Feudal lords just broken, Yan, Qi, Jing lands far, not for establish kings, not with fill them.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Wan and others said, 'The feudal lords have just been broken. Yan, Qi, and Jing lands are far away. If we do not establish kings for them, there is nothing with which to fill them.'

sentences.zh: 請立諸子，唯上幸許。」

translations.literal: Request establish various sons, only Your Majesty fortunate permit.'
translations.idiomatic: We request to establish various sons as kings. May Your Majesty fortunately permit it.'

sentences.zh: 始皇下其議於群臣，群臣皆以為便。

translations.literal: The First Emperor sent their discussion down to the ministers, and all the ministers thought it convenient.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor sent the discussion down to his ministers, and all the ministers considered it appropriate.

sentences.zh: 廷尉李斯議曰：「周文武所封子弟同姓甚眾，然後屬疏遠，相攻擊如仇讎，諸侯更相誅伐，周天子弗能禁止。

translations.literal: Court judge Li Si discussed said: 'Zhou Wen Wu what enfeoffed sons younger brothers same surname very many, then connections distant, mutually attacked like enemies, feudal lords mutually executed attacked, Zhou Son of Heaven not able prohibit.
translations.idiomatic: Court Judge Li Si discussed and said, 'The sons and younger brothers of the same surname that Zhou Wen and Wu enfeoffed were very many. Then their connections became distant, they attacked each other like enemies, the feudal lords mutually executed and attacked each other, and the Zhou Son of Heaven was not able to prohibit it.'

sentences.zh: 今海內賴陛下神靈一統，皆為郡縣，諸子功臣以公賦稅重賞賜之，甚足易制。

translations.literal: Now within the seas, relying on Your Majesty's divine spirit for unification, all are commanderies and counties. The various sons and meritorious ministers are heavily rewarded and granted from the public taxes. It is very sufficient and easy to control.'
translations.idiomatic: Now within the seas, relying on Your Majesty's divine spirit for unification, all are commanderies and counties. The various sons and meritorious ministers are heavily rewarded from the public taxes. It is very sufficient and easy to control.'

sentences.zh: 天下無異意，則安寧之術也。

translations.literal: If the world has no different intentions, then this is the method of peace and tranquility.'
translations.idiomatic: If the world has no dissenting intentions, then this is the method of peace and tranquility.'

sentences.zh: 置諸侯不便。」

translations.literal: Establish feudal lords inconvenient.'
translations.idiomatic: Establishing feudal lords is inconvenient.'

sentences.zh: 始皇曰：「天下共苦戰鬬不休，以有侯王。

translations.literal: Beginning emperor said: 'World together suffers battle struggle not stops, because has hou kings.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor said, 'The world together suffers from unending battle and struggle, because there are hou and kings.'

sentences.zh: 賴宗廟，天下初定，又復立國，是樹兵也，而求其寧息，豈不難哉！

translations.literal: Rely ancestral temple, world just settled, again establish states, this plants soldiers also, yet seek its peace rest, how not difficult!
translations.idiomatic: Relying on the ancestral temples, the world has just been settled, yet to establish states again—this is planting soldiers, and yet to seek its peace and rest, how can it not be difficult!'

sentences.zh: 分天下以為三十六郡，郡置守、尉、監。

translations.literal: The world was divided into thirty-six commanderies. Each commandery established a governor, a commandery lieutenant, and a supervisor.
translations.idiomatic: The world was divided into thirty-six commanderies. Each commandery established a governor, a commandery lieutenant, and a supervisor.

sentences.zh: 更名民曰「黔首」。

translations.literal: Change name people called 'qian shou'.
translations.idiomatic: The name of the people was changed to 'Qianshou.'

sentences.zh: 大酺。

translations.literal: There was a great celebration.
translations.idiomatic: There was a great celebration.

sentences.zh: 收天下兵，聚之咸陽，銷以為鐘鐻，金人十二，重各千石，置廷宮中。

translations.literal: Weapons from throughout the world were collected and gathered at Xianyang. They were melted to make bells and jian. Twelve golden statues were made, each weighing a thousand shi, and placed in the court palace.
translations.idiomatic: Weapons from throughout the world were collected and gathered at Xianyang. They were melted down to make bells and chimes. Twelve golden statues were made, each weighing a thousand shi, and placed in the court palace.

sentences.zh: 一法度衡石丈尺。

translations.literal: Laws, measures, balances, stones, zhang, and chi were standardized.
translations.idiomatic: Laws, measures, balances, stones, zhang, and chi were unified.

sentences.zh: 車同軌。

translations.literal: Chariots had the same track width.
translations.idiomatic: Chariots followed the same track width.

sentences.zh: 書同文字。

translations.literal: Writing used the same characters.
translations.idiomatic: Writing used the same characters.

sentences.zh: 地東至海暨朝鮮，西至臨洮、羌中，南至北向戶，北據河為塞，并陰山至遼東。

translations.literal: The lands extended east to the sea and Chaoxian, west to Lintao and Qiangzhong, south to Beixianghu, north took the river as a barrier, and extended along the Yin Mountains to Liaodong.
translations.idiomatic: The empire extended east to the sea and Chaoxian, west to Lintao and Qiangzhong, south to Beixianghu. To the north it took the Yellow River as its barrier, extending along the Yin Mountains to Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 徙天下豪富於咸陽十二萬戶。

translations.literal: One hundred twenty thousand households of the world's powerful and rich were moved to Xianyang.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred twenty thousand households of the empire's powerful and wealthy were relocated to Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 諸廟及章臺、上林皆在渭南。

translations.literal: The various temples, Zhangtai, and Shanglin were all located south of the Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The various temples, Zhangtai, and Shanglin were all located south of the Wei River.

sentences.zh: 秦每破諸侯，寫放其宮室，作之咸陽北阪上，南臨渭，自雍門以東至涇、渭，殿屋複道周閣相屬。

translations.literal: Each time Qin broke a feudal lord, they copied and modeled their palaces and chambers, building them on the northern slope of Xianyang, facing south toward the Wei. From Yong Gate eastward to the Jing and Wei, hall houses, covered ways, and winding pavilions were connected together.
translations.idiomatic: Each time Qin defeated a feudal lord, they copied and modeled their palaces and chambers, building them on the northern slope of Xianyang, facing south toward the Wei. sentences.zh: 所得諸侯美人鐘鼓，以充入之。

translations.literal: The beauties, bells, and drums obtained from the feudal lords were used to fill and enter them.
translations.idiomatic: The beauties, bells, and drums obtained from the feudal lords were used to fill and adorn them.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，始皇巡隴西、北地，出雞頭山，過回中。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, the First Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, came out at Jitou Mountain, and passed through Huizhong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the First Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, emerged at Jitou Mountain, and passed through Huizhong.

sentences.zh: 焉作信宮渭南，已更命信宮為極廟，象天極。

translations.literal: There he built the Xin Palace south of the Wei. He then changed the name of the Xin Palace to Ji Temple, imitating the extreme of heaven.
translations.idiomatic: There he built the Xin Palace south of the Wei. He then renamed the Xin Palace as Ji Temple, imitating the pole of heaven.

sentences.zh: 自極廟道通酈山，作甘泉前殿。

translations.literal: A road from the Ji Temple connected to Li Mountain, and the Ganquan Front Hall was built.
translations.idiomatic: A road was built from the Ji Temple connecting to Li Mountain, and the Ganquan Front Hall was constructed.

sentences.zh: 筑甬道，自咸陽屬之。

translations.literal: A covered way was built connecting it from Xianyang.
translations.idiomatic: A covered walkway was built connecting it from Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 是歲，賜爵一級。

translations.literal: That year, nobility ranks were granted one level higher.
translations.idiomatic: That year, nobility ranks were granted one level higher.

sentences.zh: 治馳道。

translations.literal: Gallop roads were administered.
translations.idiomatic: Gallop roads were maintained.

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, the Beginning Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, came out at Jitoushan, and passed through Huizhong. There he made the Xin palace south of the Wei.
