sentences.zh: 二十八年，始皇東行郡縣，上鄒嶧山。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the First Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties, and ascended Zouyishan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the First Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties, ascending Zouyishan.

sentences.zh: 立石，與魯諸儒生議，刻石頌秦德，議封禪望祭山川之事。

translations.literal: He erected a stone and discussed with the various scholars from Lu. He carved on the stone to praise Qin's virtue, and discussed the matters of feng and shan sacrifices, hoping to sacrifice to the mountains and rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He erected a stone and discussed with various scholars from Lu. He carved on the stone to praise Qin's virtue, and discussed the matters of feng and shan sacrifices to offer sacrifices to the mountains and rivers.

sentences.zh: 乃遂上泰山，立石，封，祠祀。

translations.literal: He then ascended Mount Tai, erected a stone, performed the feng sacrifice, and made sacrificial offerings.
translations.idiomatic: He then ascended Mount Tai, erected a stone, performed the feng sacrifice, and offered sacrificial rites.

sentences.zh: 下，風雨暴至，休於樹下，因封其樹為五大夫。

translations.literal: As he descended, violent wind and rain arrived. He rested under a tree, and therefore enfeoffed the tree as a Five Great Man.
translations.idiomatic: As he descended, violent wind and rain arrived. He rested under a tree, and therefore enfeoffed the tree as a Five Great Man.

sentences.zh: 禪梁父。

translations.literal: He performed the shan sacrifice at Liangfu.
translations.idiomatic: He performed the shan sacrifice at Liangfu.

sentences.zh: 刻所立石，其辭曰：

translations.literal: Carved erected stone, its words said:
translations.idiomatic: He carved on the erected stone, and its words said:

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the Beginning Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties, ascending Zoui Shan. He erected a stone and discussed with various Lu scholar disciples, carving on the stone praise for Qin's virtue, and discussed the feng and shan sacrifices and hoped-for sacrifices to mountains and rivers. He then ascended Taishan, erected a stone, performed the feng sacrifice, and made sacrificial offerings. On descending, wind and rain arrived violently. He rested under a tree, therefore feng-ing the tree as Five Great Men. He performed the shan at Liangfu. He carved on the erected stone, its words saying:

sentences.zh: 皇帝臨位，作制明法，臣下修飭。

translations.literal: The Emperor assumes the position, establishes systems and clarifies laws; the ministers below repair their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor assumes his position, establishes systems and clarifies laws; the ministers below mend their conduct.

sentences.zh: 二十有六年，初并天下，罔不賓服。

translations.literal: For twenty-six years, he initially united the world; none failed to submit and obey.
translations.idiomatic: For twenty-six years, he initially united the world; none failed to submit and obey.

sentences.zh: 親巡遠方黎民，登茲泰山，周覽東極。

translations.literal: He personally toured the distant places and common people, ascended this Mount Tai, and comprehensively viewed the eastern extreme.
translations.idiomatic: He personally toured the distant regions and common people, ascended this Mount Tai, and comprehensively viewed the eastern extreme.

sentences.zh: 從臣思跡，本原事業，祗誦功德。

translations.literal: The attendant ministers think of the traces, fundamentally originate the affairs, and respectfully recite the merits and virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The attendant ministers reflect on the traces, fundamentally originate the affairs, and respectfully recite the merits and virtue.

sentences.zh: 治道運行，諸產得宜，皆有法式。

translations.literal: The governing way operates; various productions obtain what is appropriate; all have laws and forms.
translations.idiomatic: The governing way operates; various productions obtain what is appropriate; all have laws and forms.

sentences.zh: 大義休明，垂于後世，順承勿革。

translations.literal: Great righteousness is beautifully bright, hanging down to later generations; obey and receive it, do not change.
translations.idiomatic: Great righteousness is beautifully bright, extending to later generations; obey and receive it, do not change.

sentences.zh: 皇帝躬聖，既平天下，不懈於治。

translations.literal: The Emperor is personally holy; having already pacified the world, he is not slack in governing.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor is personally holy; having already pacified the world, he is not slack in governing.

sentences.zh: 夙興夜寐，建設長利，專隆教誨。

translations.literal: Rising early and sleeping late, he establishes and builds long-lasting profit, specializing in lofty teaching and instruction.
translations.idiomatic: Rising early and sleeping late, he establishes and builds long-lasting benefits, specializing in lofty teaching and instruction.

sentences.zh: 訓經宣達，遠近畢理，咸承聖志。

translations.literal: Instructions and classics are proclaimed and reach; distant and near are all managed; all receive the holy will.
translations.idiomatic: Instructions and classics are proclaimed and reach; distant and near are all managed; all receive the holy will.

sentences.zh: 貴賤分明，男女禮順，慎遵職事。

translations.literal: Noble and base are clearly divided; male and female rites are proper; carefully comply with office matters.
translations.idiomatic: Noble and base are clearly divided; male and female rites are proper; carefully comply with office matters.

sentences.zh: 昭隔內外，靡不清凈，施于後嗣。

translations.literal: Brightly separating inner and outer, nothing is not clear and pure; bestowed to later descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Brightly separating inner and outer, nothing is not clear and pure; bestowed to later descendants.

sentences.zh: 化及無窮，遵奉遺詔，永承重戒。

translations.literal: The transformation reaches endlessly; comply with and offer the posthumous edict; eternally receive the heavy admonition.
translations.idiomatic: The transformation reaches endlessly; comply with and offer the posthumous edict; eternally receive the heavy admonition.

translations.literal: The emperor assumes his position, makes systems and clear laws, ministers below repair their conduct. In the twenty-sixth year, initially uniting the world, none did not submit and obey. Personally touring distant places and the common people, ascending this Taishan, comprehensively viewing the eastern extreme. Attendant ministers think of the traces, fundamentally originate affairs, respectfully recite the merits and virtue. The governing way operates, various productions obtain what is appropriate, all have laws and forms. Great righteousness is beautiful and bright, hangs to later generations, obey and receive, do not change. The emperor is personally holy, has already pacified the world, not slack at governing. Early rising and late sleeping, establishing and building long-lasting profit, specialized and lofty teaching and instruction. Instructions and classics proclaim and reach, distant and near all managed, all receive the holy will. Noble and base are clearly divided, male and female rites are proper, careful compliance with office matters. Brightly separate inner and outer, nothing is not clear and pure, bestowed to later descendants. Transformation reaches endlessly, comply and offer the posthumous edict, eternally receive the heavy admonition.

sentences.zh: 於是乃并勃海以東，過黃、腄，窮成山，登之罘，立石頌秦德焉而去。

translations.literal: Thereupon he went along the Bohai Sea to the east, passed Huang and Zhu, reached the end of Chengshan, ascended Zhifu, erected a stone there praising Qin's virtue, and left.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he went along the Bohai Sea to the east, passed Huang and Zhu, reached the end of Chengshan, ascended Zhifu, erected a stone there praising Qin's virtue, and departed.

translations.literal: Thereupon he went along the Bohai Sea eastward, passed through Huang and Zhu, exhausted Chengshan, ascended Zhifu, erected a stone praising Qin's virtue there and left.

sentences.zh: 南登瑯邪，大樂之，留三月。

translations.literal: He ascended Langye to the south, greatly delighted in it, and stayed three months.
translations.idiomatic: He ascended Langye to the south, greatly delighted in it, and stayed three months.

sentences.zh: 乃徙黔首三萬戶瑯邪臺下，復十二歲。

translations.literal: He then moved thirty thousand households of qianshou below the Langye terrace, exempting them for twelve years.
translations.idiomatic: He then moved thirty thousand households of commoners below the Langye terrace, exempting them from taxes for twelve years.

sentences.zh: 作瑯邪臺，立石刻，頌秦德，明得意。

translations.literal: He made the Langye terrace, erected stone carvings, praised Qin's virtue, and made clear his obtained intentions.
translations.idiomatic: He made the Langye terrace, erected stone carvings, praised Qin's virtue, and made clear his obtained intentions.

sentences.zh: 曰：

translations.literal: Said:
translations.idiomatic: It said:

translations.literal: He ascended Langye to the south, greatly delighted in it, and stayed three months. He then moved thirty thousand households of qianshou below Langye Terrace, exempting them for twelve years. He made Langye Terrace, erected stone carvings, praised Qin's virtue, made clear the obtained intention. It said:

sentences.zh: 維二十八年，皇帝作始。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the Emperor made the beginning.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the Emperor made the beginning.

sentences.zh: 端平法度，萬物之紀。

translations.literal: Upright and level are the laws and measures, the record of the ten thousand things.
translations.idiomatic: Upright and level are the laws and measures, the record of the ten thousand things.

sentences.zh: 以明人事，合同父子。

translations.literal: With this he clarifies human affairs, unites fathers and sons in contract.
translations.idiomatic: With this he clarifies human affairs, unites fathers and sons in harmony.

sentences.zh: 聖智仁義，顯白道理。

translations.literal: Holy wisdom, benevolence, righteousness—manifest and white are the principles and way.
translations.idiomatic: Holy wisdom, benevolence, righteousness—manifest and clear are the principles and way.

sentences.zh: 東撫東土，以省卒士。

translations.literal: He strokes the eastern lands to inspect the soldiers and scholars.
translations.idiomatic: He strokes the eastern lands to inspect the soldiers and scholars.

sentences.zh: 事已大畢，乃臨于海。

translations.literal: The affairs are already greatly finished; he then approaches the sea.
translations.idiomatic: The affairs are already greatly finished; he then approaches the sea.

sentences.zh: 皇帝之功，勸勞本事。

translations.literal: The Emperor's merit encourages toil in fundamental affairs.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor's merit encourages toil in fundamental affairs.

sentences.zh: 上農除末，黔首是富。

translations.literal: Honoring agriculture and eliminating trade, the qianshou thereby become rich.
translations.idiomatic: Honoring agriculture and eliminating trade, the commoners thereby become rich.

sentences.zh: 普天之下，摶心揖志。

translations.literal: Under universal heaven, hearts unite and wills bow.
translations.idiomatic: Under universal heaven, hearts unite and wills submit.

sentences.zh: 器械一量，同書文字。

translations.literal: Instruments and weapons have one measure; writing has the same characters.
translations.idiomatic: Instruments and weapons have one measure; writing has the same characters.

sentences.zh: 日月所照，舟輿所載。

translations.literal: Wherever sun and moon shine, wherever boats and carriages carry.
translations.idiomatic: Wherever sun and moon shine, wherever boats and carriages carry.

sentences.zh: 皆終其命，莫不得意。

translations.literal: All complete their allotted span; none fail to obtain their intentions.
translations.idiomatic: All complete their allotted span; none fail to obtain their intentions.

sentences.zh: 應時動事，是維皇帝。

translations.literal: Responding to the times and moving affairs—this is truly the Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Responding to the times and moving affairs—this is truly the Emperor.

sentences.zh: 匡飭異俗，陵水經地。

translations.literal: Aid and correct different customs; cross waters and measure the earth.
translations.idiomatic: Aid and correct different customs; cross waters and measure the earth.

sentences.zh: 憂恤黔首，朝夕不懈。

translations.literal: He worries and pities the qianshou, morning and evening without slackening.
translations.idiomatic: He worries and pities the commoners, morning and evening without slackening.

sentences.zh: 除疑定法，咸知所辟。

translations.literal: Remove doubts and establish laws; all know what to avoid.
translations.idiomatic: Remove doubts and establish laws; all know what to avoid.

sentences.zh: 方伯分職，諸治經易。

translations.literal: The fang bo divide their duties; the various administrations manage easily.
translations.idiomatic: The fang bo divide their duties; the various administrations manage easily.

sentences.zh: 舉錯必當，莫不如畫。

translations.literal: Raising and lowering are necessarily proper; none are not as planned.
translations.idiomatic: Raising and lowering are necessarily proper; none are not as planned.

sentences.zh: 皇帝之明，臨察四方。

translations.literal: The Emperor's brightness oversees and inspects the four directions.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor's brightness oversees and inspects the four directions.

sentences.zh: 尊卑貴賤，不踰次行。

translations.literal: High and low, noble and base do not exceed the order in their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: High and low, noble and base do not exceed the order in their conduct.

sentences.zh: 瑯邪不容，皆務貞良。

translations.literal: Langye does not tolerate them; all strive to be chaste and good.
translations.idiomatic: Langye does not tolerate them; all strive to be chaste and good.

sentences.zh: 細大盡力，莫敢怠荒。

translations.literal: Fine and large exhaust their strength; none dare be lazy or neglectful.
translations.idiomatic: Fine and large exhaust their strength; none dare be lazy or neglectful.

sentences.zh: 遠邇辟隱，專務肅莊。

translations.literal: Distant and near avoid concealment; they specialize in striving for solemn dignity.
translations.idiomatic: Distant and near avoid concealment; they specialize in striving for solemn dignity.

sentences.zh: 端直敦忠，事業有常。

translations.literal: Upright and straight, sincere and loyal—their affairs have constancy.
translations.idiomatic: Upright and straight, sincere and loyal—their affairs have constancy.

sentences.zh: 皇帝之德，存定四極。

translations.literal: The Emperor's virtue preserves and stabilizes the four extremes.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor's virtue preserves and stabilizes the four extremes.

sentences.zh: 誅亂除害，興利致福。

translations.literal: Execute chaos and remove harm; raise benefit and bring fortune.
translations.idiomatic: Execute chaos and remove harm; raise benefit and bring fortune.

sentences.zh: 節事以時，諸產繁殖。

translations.literal: Restrain affairs according to the seasons; various productions multiply.
translations.idiomatic: Restrain affairs according to the seasons; various productions multiply.

sentences.zh: 黔首安寧，不用兵革。

translations.literal: The qianshou are peaceful and tranquil; weapons and armor are not used.
translations.idiomatic: The commoners are peaceful and tranquil; weapons and armor are not used.

sentences.zh: 六親相保，終無寇賊。

translations.literal: The six relatives mutually protect each other; there are finally no bandits or robbers.
translations.idiomatic: The six relatives mutually protect each other; there are finally no bandits or robbers.

sentences.zh: 驩欣奉教，盡知法式。

translations.literal: Joyfully and happily they receive the teaching; they completely know the laws and forms.
translations.idiomatic: Joyfully and happily they receive the teaching; they completely know the laws and forms.

sentences.zh: 六合之內，皇帝之土。

translations.literal: Within the six directions, it is the Emperor's soil.
translations.idiomatic: Within the six directions, it is the Emperor's soil.

sentences.zh: 西涉流沙，南盡北戶。

translations.literal: West he fords the flowing sands; south he reaches the northern doors.
translations.idiomatic: West he fords the flowing sands; south he reaches the northern doors.

sentences.zh: 東有東海，北過大夏。

translations.literal: East there is the Eastern Sea; north he passes Great Xia.
translations.idiomatic: East there is the Eastern Sea; north he passes Great Xia.

sentences.zh: 人跡所至，無不臣者。

translations.literal: Wherever human tracks reach, none are not subjects.
translations.idiomatic: Wherever human tracks reach, none are not subjects.

sentences.zh: 功蓋五帝，澤及牛馬。

translations.literal: His merit covers the Five Emperors; his favor reaches oxen and horses.
translations.idiomatic: His merit covers the Five Emperors; his favor reaches oxen and horses.

sentences.zh: 莫不受德，各安其宇。

translations.literal: None do not receive virtue; each is peaceful in their dwelling.
translations.idiomatic: None do not receive virtue; each is peaceful in their dwelling.

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the emperor made the beginning. Upright and level laws and measures, the record of the ten thousand things. With this to clarify human affairs, unite father and son in contract. Holy wisdom, benevolence, and righteousness manifest and make white the principles and way. Eastward he strokes the eastern lands, to inspect the soldiers and scholars. Affairs already greatly finished, then he approached the sea. The emperor's merit encourages toil in fundamental affairs. Honor agriculture, eliminate trade, the qianshou are rich thereby. Under universal heaven, unite hearts and bow wills. Instruments and weapons have one measure, same writing and characters. What the sun and moon shine upon, what boats and carriages carry. All complete their fate, none do not obtain their intention. Respond to the time and move affairs, this is only the emperor. Aid and correct different customs, cross waters and measure the earth. Worry and pity the qianshou, morning and evening not slack. Remove doubts and establish laws, all know what to avoid. Fang bo divide their duties, various administrations manage easily. Raise and lower must be proper, none not as planned. The emperor's brightness oversees and inspects the four directions. Honor and base, noble and base, do not exceed their order and conduct. Langye does not tolerate, all strive for chastity and goodness. Fine and large exhaust their strength, none dare be lazy or neglect. Distant and near avoid concealment, specialized in striving for solemnity and dignity. Upright and straight, sincere and loyal, affairs have constancy. The emperor's virtue preserves and stabilizes the four extremes. Execute chaos and remove harm, raise benefit and bring fortune. Restrain affairs by time, various productions multiply. The qianshou are peaceful and tranquil, not using weapons or armor. The six relatives mutually protect, ultimately without bandits or robbers. Joyful and happy receiving teaching, completely know the laws and forms. Within the six directions, the emperor's soil. West ford the flowing sands, south exhaust the north doors. East has the Eastern Sea, north passes Great Xia. Where human tracks reach, none are not subjects. Merit covers the Five Emperors, favor reaches oxen and horses. None do not receive virtue, each peaceful in their dwelling.

sentences.zh: 維秦王兼有天下，立名為皇帝，乃撫東土，至于瑯邪。

translations.literal: Truly the King of Qin united and possessed the world, established his name as Emperor, then stroked the eastern lands, reaching Langye.
translations.idiomatic: Truly the King of Qin united and possessed the world, established his name as Emperor, then stroked the eastern lands, reaching Langye.

sentences.zh: 列侯武城侯王離、列侯通武侯王賁、倫侯建成侯趙亥、倫侯昌武侯成、倫侯武信侯馮毋擇、丞相隗林、丞相王綰、卿李斯、卿王戊、五大夫趙嬰、五大夫楊樛從，與議於海上。

translations.literal: The liehou Marquis of Wucheng Wang Li, the liehou Marquis of Tongwu Wang Ben, the lunhou Marquis of Jiancheng Zhao Hai, the lunhou Marquis of Changwu Cheng, the lunhou Marquis of Wuxin Feng Wuze, Chancellor Wei Lin, Chancellor Wang Wan, Minister Li Si, Minister Wang Wu, Five Great Man Zhao Ying, Five Great Man Yang Qiao followed, and discussed with him at the seaside.
translations.idiomatic: The liehou Marquis of Wucheng Wang Li, the liehou Marquis of Tongwu Wang Ben, the lunhou Marquis of Jiancheng Zhao Hai, the lunhou Marquis of Changwu Cheng, the lunhou Marquis of Wuxin Feng Wuze, Chancellor Wei Lin, Chancellor Wang Wan, Minister Li Si, Minister Wang Wu, Five Great Man Zhao Ying, Five Great Man Yang Qiao followed, and discussed with him at the seaside.

sentences.zh: 曰：「古之帝者，地不過千里，諸侯各守其封域，或朝或否，相侵暴亂，殘伐不止，猶刻金石，以自為紀。

translations.literal: Said: 'Ancient of emperors, land not exceed thousand li, feudal lords each guard their fief domains, some court some not, mutually invade violent chaos, cruel attacks not stop, still carve metal stone, to self as record.
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'The emperors of antiquity—their lands did not exceed a thousand li. The feudal lords each guarded their fief domains, some came to court and some did not, mutually invading in violent chaos, cruel attacks without stopping. Still they carved metal and stone to make records for themselves.'

sentences.zh: 古之五帝三王，知教不同，法度不明，假威鬼神，以欺遠方，實不稱名，故不久長。

translations.literal: The Five Emperors and Three Kings of antiquity—their knowledge and teachings were different, their laws and measures were not clear. They borrowed the power of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant places. In reality they did not match their names, therefore they did not last long.'
translations.idiomatic: The Five Emperors and Three Kings of antiquity—their knowledge and teachings were different, their laws and measures were not clear. They borrowed the power of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant places. In reality they did not match their names, therefore they did not last long.'

sentences.zh: 其身未歿，諸侯倍叛，法令不行。

translations.literal: While their persons had not yet died, the feudal lords doubly rebelled; laws and commands were not carried out.'
translations.idiomatic: While their persons had not yet died, the feudal lords doubly rebelled; laws and commands were not carried out.'

sentences.zh: 今皇帝并一海內，以為郡縣，天下和平。

translations.literal: Now the Emperor unites the world within the seas as commanderies and counties; the world is peaceful.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Emperor unites the world within the seas as commanderies and counties; the world is peaceful.'

sentences.zh: 昭明宗廟，體道行德，尊號大成。

translations.literal: He brightens and clarifies the ancestral temples, embodies the way and practices virtue; the honored title is greatly completed.'
translations.idiomatic: He brightens and clarifies the ancestral temples, embodies the way and practices virtue; the honored title is greatly completed.'

sentences.zh: 群臣相與誦皇帝功德，刻于金石，以為表經。」

translations.literal: Ministers mutually recite emperor merit virtue, carve on metal stone, to be standard classic.'
translations.idiomatic: The ministers mutually recite the Emperor's merit and virtue, carve it on metal and stone, to be the standard classic.'

translations.literal: Only the Qin king united and possessed the world, established the name as emperor, then stroked the eastern lands, reaching Langye. Liehou Wucheng Hou Wang Li, liehou Tongwu Hou Wang Ben, lunhou Jiancheng Hou Zhao Hai, lunhou Changwu Hou Cheng, lunhou Wuxin Hou Feng Wu Ze, Chancellor Wei Lin, Chancellor Wang Wan, Qing Li Si, Qing Wang Wu, Five Great Men Zhao Ying, Five Great Men Yang Qiao followed, and discussed at the seaside. Said: 'The ancient emperors' lands did not exceed a thousand li. The feudal lords each guarded their fief domains, some came to court and some did not. They mutually invaded and caused violent chaos, cruel attacks did not stop. Still they carved metal and stone, to be their own record. The ancient Five Emperors and Three Kings had different knowledge and teachings, unclear laws and measures. They borrowed the power of ghosts and spirits to deceive distant places. In reality they did not match their name, therefore they were not long-lasting. While they were still alive, the feudal lords doubled their rebellion, laws and commands were not carried out. Now the emperor unites the one within the seas, makes it commanderies and counties, the world is peaceful. Brightly clear the ancestral temple, embody the way and practice virtue, honored title greatly completed. The ministers mutually recite the emperor's merit and virtue, carve on metal and stone, to be the standard classic.'

sentences.zh: 既已，齊人徐市等上書，言海中有三神山，名曰蓬萊、方丈、瀛洲，僊人居之。

translations.literal: Having done this, the Qi man Xu Shi and others presented a memorial saying that in the sea there are three divine mountains, named Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, where immortals dwell.
translations.idiomatic: Having done this, the Qi man Xu Shi and others presented a memorial saying that in the sea there are three divine mountains, named Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, where immortals dwell.

sentences.zh: 請得齋戒，與童男女求之。

translations.literal: They requested to obtain fasting and purification, and seek them with virgin boys and girls.
translations.idiomatic: They requested to obtain fasting and purification, and seek them with virgin boys and girls.

sentences.zh: 於是遣徐市發童男女數千人，入海求僊人。

translations.literal: Thereupon he dispatched Xu Shi to send several thousand virgin boys and girls to enter the sea and seek the immortals.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he dispatched Xu Shi to send several thousand virgin boys and girls to enter the sea and seek the immortals.

translations.literal: Already thus, the Qi person Xu Shi and others presented a memorial, saying that in the sea there are three divine mountains, named Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, where xian people dwell. They requested to obtain fasting and purification, and with virgin boys and girls seek them. Thereupon he dispatched Xu Shi to send several thousand virgin boys and girls to enter the sea and seek the xian people.

sentences.zh: 始皇還，過彭城，齋戒禱祠，欲出周鼎泗水。

translations.literal: The First Emperor returned, passed through Pengcheng, fasted and purified, prayed and sacrificed, wishing to bring out the Zhou tripod from the Si River.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor returned, passed through Pengcheng, fasted and purified, prayed and sacrificed, wishing to bring out the Zhou tripod from the Si River.

sentences.zh: 使千人沒水求之，弗得。

translations.literal: He made a thousand people dive into the water to seek it, but they did not obtain it.
translations.idiomatic: He made a thousand people dive into the water to seek it, but they did not obtain it.

sentences.zh: 乃西南渡淮水，之衡山、南郡。

translations.literal: He then crossed the Huai River to the southwest, going to Mount Heng and Nang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: He then crossed the Huai River to the southwest, going to Mount Heng and Nang commandery.

sentences.zh: 浮江，至湘山祠。

translations.literal: He floated down the Jiang and reached Mount Xiang to sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: He floated down the Jiang and reached Mount Xiang to sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 逢大風，幾不得渡。

translations.literal: He encountered a great wind and almost could not cross.
translations.idiomatic: He encountered a great wind and almost could not cross.

sentences.zh: 上問博士曰：「湘君神？」

translations.literal: His Majesty asked scholars said: 'Xiang jun spirit?'
translations.idiomatic: His Majesty asked the scholars, 'Is it the Xiangjun spirit?'

translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty possesses within the seas, yet your sons and younger brothers are common men. Suddenly there may be ministers like Tian Chang or the Six Ministers, with no support or brush—how will you mutually save each other?'

sentences.zh: 事不師古而能長久者，非所聞也。

translations.literal: Affairs that do not take the ancient as teacher yet are able to last long—that is not what I have heard.'

translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor sent down their discussion.

sentences.zh: 丞相李斯曰：「五帝不相復，三代不相襲，各以治，非其相反，時變異也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Li Si said: 'Five emperors not mutually repeat, three dynasties not mutually follow, each with governance, not their oppose reverse, time changed different also.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Li Si said, 'The Five Emperors did not mutually repeat each other, the Three Dynasties did not mutually follow each other. Each governed with their own ways; it is not that they opposed and reversed each other—times changed and were different.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下創大業，建萬世之功，固非愚儒所知。

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise and established merit for ten thousand generations. This is certainly not known by foolish scholars.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty has created a great enterprise and established merit for ten thousand generations. This is certainly not known by foolish scholars.'

sentences.zh: 且越言乃三代之事，何足法也？

translations.literal: Moreover Yue words are three dynasties matters, what sufficient model also?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Yue's words are matters of the Three Dynasties—what is sufficient to model after?'

sentences.zh: 異時諸侯并爭，厚招游學。

translations.literal: In different times, the feudal lords contended together and thickly recruited wandering scholars.'
translations.idiomatic: In different times, the feudal lords contended together and thickly recruited wandering scholars.'

sentences.zh: 今天下已定，法令出一，百姓當家則力農工，士則學習法令辟禁。

translations.literal: Now the world is already determined, laws and commands come out as one. When common people are at home, they exert themselves in agriculture and labor; scholars study and learn the laws and commands, avoiding prohibitions.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the world is already determined, laws and commands come out as one. When common people are at home, they exert themselves in agriculture and labor; scholars study and learn the laws and commands, avoiding prohibitions.'

sentences.zh: 今諸生不師今而學古，以非當世，惑亂黔首。

translations.literal: Now the various scholars do not take the present as teacher but study the ancient, in order to oppose the current age and confuse and disorder the qianshou.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the various scholars do not take the present as teacher but study the ancient, in order to oppose the current age and confuse and disorder the commoners.'

translations.literal: Chancellor minister Si risking death speaks: Ancient ones world scattered chaotic, none able unify it, therefore feudal lords together arose, words all spoke ancient to harm present, adorned empty words to disorder reality, people favored their private studies, to oppose superiors established.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Minister Si, risking death, speaks: In ancient times the world was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it. Therefore the feudal lords arose together; their words all spoke of the ancient to harm the present, adorned empty words to disorder reality. People favored their private studies to oppose what their superiors had established.'

sentences.zh: 今皇帝并有天下，別黑白而定一尊。

translations.literal: Now the Emperor has united and possesses the world, distinguishes black and white and determines one honored.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Emperor has united and possesses the world, distinguishes black and white and determines one honored.'

sentences.zh: 私學而相與非法教，人聞令下，則各以其學議之，入則心非，出則巷議，夸主以為名，異取以為高，率群下以造謗。

translations.literal: If like this it is not prohibited, then the ruler's power will descend to the superiors, and factions and alliances will form below.'
translations.idiomatic: If like this it is not prohibited, then the ruler's power will descend to the superiors, and factions and alliances will form below.'

translations.literal: Prohibiting it is convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: Prohibiting it is convenient.'

translations.literal: I request that the court historians burn all records that are not of Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: I request that the court historians burn all records that are not of Qin.'

sentences.zh: 非博士官所職，天下敢有藏詩、書、百家語者，悉詣守、尉雜燒之。

translations.literal: Those not in the charge of the scholar officials—throughout the world, those who dare to hide poems, books, and the words of the Hundred Schools, all go to the commandery governors and commandery lieutenants to mix and burn them.'
translations.idiomatic: Those not in the charge of the scholar officials—throughout the world, those who dare to hide poems, books, and the words of the Hundred Schools, all go to the commandery governors and commandery lieutenants to mix and burn them.'

translations.literal: Those who dare to discuss poems and books in pairs shall be abandoned in the market.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who dare to discuss poems and books in pairs shall be abandoned in the market.'

sentences.zh: 以古非今者族。

translations.literal: Those who use the ancient to oppose the present shall be clanned.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who use the ancient to oppose the present shall be clanned.'

sentences.zh: 吏見知不舉者與同罪。

translations.literal: Officials who see and know but do not report shall be with the same crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials who see and know but do not report shall be with the same crime.'

translations.literal: If within thirty days of the command descending they do not burn, tattoo them as city morning.'
translations.idiomatic: If within thirty days of the command descending they do not burn, tattoo them as city morning.'

translations.literal: Those not to be removed are books of medicine, divination, divination, and planting trees.'
translations.idiomatic: Those not to be removed are books of medicine, divination, and planting trees.'

sentences.zh: 若欲有學法令，以吏為師。」

translations.literal: If desire have study laws commands, take officials as teachers.'

sentences.zh: 三十五年，除道，道九原抵雲陽，塹山堙谷，直通之。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, roads were cleared. The road from Jiuyuan reached Yunyang; mountains were moated and valleys filled to directly connect them.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, roads were cleared. The road from Jiuyuan reached Yunyang; mountains were moated and valleys filled to directly connect them.

sentences.zh: 於是始皇以為咸陽人多，先王之宮廷小，吾聞周文王都豐，武王都鎬，豐鎬之閒，帝王之都也。

translations.literal: Thereupon the First Emperor thought that Xianyang had many people, but the former kings' palace courts were small. I have heard that Zhou King Wen's capital was Feng, King Wu's capital was Hao. Between Feng and Hao is where emperors and kings have their capitals.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the First Emperor thought that Xianyang had many people, but the former kings' palace courts were small. I have heard that Zhou King Wen's capital was Feng, King Wu's capital was Hao. Between Feng and Hao is where emperors and kings have their capitals.

sentences.zh: 乃營作朝宮渭南上林苑中。

translations.literal: He then planned and made a court palace in the Shanglin Park south of the Wei.
translations.idiomatic: He then planned and made a court palace in the Shanglin Park south of the Wei.

sentences.zh: 先作前殿阿房，東西五百步，南北五十丈，上可以坐萬人，下可以建五丈旗。

translations.literal: First he made the front hall Epang, five hundred paces east-west, fifty zhang north-south. Above it could seat ten thousand people; below it could erect five zhang flags.
translations.idiomatic: First he made the front hall Epang, five hundred paces east-west, fifty zhang north-south. Above it could seat ten thousand people; below it could erect five zhang flags.

sentences.zh: 周馳為閣道，自殿下直抵南山。

translations.literal: He circled and galloped as a covered way, from below the hall straight to the southern mountain.
translations.idiomatic: He circled and galloped as a covered way, from below the hall straight to the southern mountain.

sentences.zh: 表南山之顛以為闕。

translations.literal: He marked the southern mountain's summit as a que.
translations.idiomatic: He marked the southern mountain's summit as a que.

sentences.zh: 為復道，自阿房渡渭，屬之咸陽，以象天極閣道絕漢抵營室也。

translations.literal: He made a covered way from Epang crossing the Wei, connecting to Xianyang, to imitate the heaven extreme's covered way that cuts across the Han and reaches Yingshi.
translations.idiomatic: He made a covered way from Epang crossing the Wei, connecting to Xianyang, to imitate the heaven extreme's covered way that cuts across the Han and reaches Yingshi.

translations.idiomatic: He made the palace Epang, therefore the world called it the Epang Palace.

translations.idiomatic: He sent for Beishan stone coffins, then modeled Shu and Jing lands' timbers—all arrived.

translations.idiomatic: In Guanzhong there were counted three hundred palaces; outside the passes four hundred more.

translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he erected a stone on the eastern sea in the boundary of Shangqu, to be Qin's eastern gate.

translations.idiomatic: If the person lord's dwelling is known by person ministers, then it harms the spirits.'

translations.idiomatic: He then ordered that within two hundred li beside Xianyang, two hundred seventy palace buildings with covered ways and walled ways connected, filled with curtains, canopies, bells, drums, and beauties, each according to their names not to be moved or transferred.

translations.literal: Where he travels and what he favors—if there are those who speak of its place, the crime is death.
translations.idiomatic: Where he travels and what he favors—if there are those who speak of its place, the crime is death.

translations.literal: The First Emperor favored the Liangshan Palace. From the mountain top he saw that the chancellor's chariot cavalry were many—it was not good.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor favored the Liangshan Palace. From the mountain top he saw that the chancellor's chariot cavalry were many—it was not good.

translations.idiomatic: Inner people or told the chancellor; afterwards the chancellor reduced his chariot cavalry.

translations.literal: He investigated and questioned, but none confessed.
translations.idiomatic: He investigated and questioned, but none confessed.

translations.idiomatic: At that time, by edict he captured all those who were then at his side, and killed them all.

translations.idiomatic: From this time on, none knew the location of his travels.

sentences.zh: 專任獄吏，獄吏得親幸。

translations.literal: He specially employed prison officials; the prison officials obtained close favor.'
translations.idiomatic: He specially employed prison officials; the prison officials obtained close favor.'

translations.literal: Though there are seventy scholars, they are specially prepared members but not used.'
translations.idiomatic: Though there are seventy scholars, they are specially prepared members but not used.'

translations.literal: The chancellor and various ministers all receive completed affairs, rely on and argue with His Majesty.'
translations.idiomatic: The chancellor and various ministers all receive completed affairs, rely on and argue with His Majesty.'

translations.idiomatic: His Majesty does not hear faults but daily becomes arrogant; below they are terrified, submissive, falsely deceive to gain favor.'

translations.idiomatic: They traveled from the straight road to Xianyang and issued mourning.

translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Huhai ascended the throne and became the Second Generation Emperor.

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, they buried the First Emperor at Lishan.

translations.literal: Thereupon the Second Generation then followed and used Zhao Gao, extending the laws and commands. He then secretly plotted with Zhao Gao, saying: 'The ministers do not submit, the officials are still strong, and the various princes will certainly contend with me. What to do about it?' Gao said: 'I, your minister, certainly wished to speak but did not dare. The former emperor's ministers were all the world's accumulated generations of famous noble people, who had accumulated merits and labors for generations mutually transmitted for a long time already. Now I, Gao, was originally small and lowly. Your Majesty fortunately praised and raised me, commanding me in an upper position to manage middle affairs. The ministers are dissatisfied. They specially with appearance follow as ministers, but their hearts actually do not submit. Now His Majesty goes out. Not taking this time to investigate the commanderies and counties' defenders and commandants who have crimes and execute them. Above to shake might throughout the world, below to remove those His Majesty in his lifetime disliked. Now the time does not model culture but decides at military force. I wish Your Majesty would then follow the time without doubt, then the ministers would not be able to plot. A bright lord collects and raises the remaining people, makes the lowly noble, the poor rich, the distant near, then upper and lower gather and the state is peaceful.' None were able to stand. Six princes were punished and died at Du. Prince Jianglü and his two brothers were imprisoned in the inner palace. Their crimes were discussed alone later. translations.idiomatic: Sheng established himself as Chu king, resided in Chen, and dispatched various generals to tour the lands.

Affairs then have errors, show the ministers your shortcomings. The emperor calls 'I', certainly does not hear the voice.' Thereupon the Second Generation constantly resided in the forbidden quarters, deciding all affairs with Gao. After that, the nobles rarely obtained morning audiences. Robbers and bandits increasingly many. The Guanzhong soldiers dispatched east to strike robbers had no end. Right Chancellor Qu Ji, Left Chancellor Si, General Feng Jie advanced and remonstrated, saying: 'East of the pass bandits together rose. Qin dispatched troops to execute and strike. Those killed and perished were very many, however still not stopped. Robbers are many. All because garrison, transport, labor matters are bitter. Taxes are heavy. Please temporarily stop the Efang Palace workers, reduce and save the four borders' garrisons and transports.' The Second Generation said: 'I heard Master Han say: 'Yao and Shun's thatched rafters were not scraped, thatched roofs not trimmed, ate from earthenware bowls, drank from earthenware cups. Though gatekeeper's nourishment, not different from this. Yu dug Longmen, connected Daxia, decided Hetting waters, released to sea. His body self-held hoe and spade, shins had no hair. Minister and captive labor was not more intense than this.' All those who are noble in having the world obtain unrestrained intentions and extreme desires. The lord makes heavy and clear laws. Below they do not dare do wrong, to control and rule within the seas. The lords of Yu and Xia were noble as emperors, personally dwelt in the reality of poor bitterness, to comply with the common people. What more at laws? I am honored with ten thousand chariots, but not its substance. I wish to make thousand chariots' equipage, ten thousand chariots' retinue, to fill my title and name. Moreover the former emperor rose from feudal lords, united the world. The world was already settled. Externally expelled the four barbarians to pacify the border limits. Made palace chambers to manifest self-satisfaction. And you observe the former emperor's achievements had continuity. Now I have ascended the position within two years' interval. Bandits together rose. You cannot prohibit. Moreover wish to dismiss what the former emperor did. This is above not able to repay the former emperor, next not exhausting loyal strength for me. Why be in position?' Sent down Qu Ji, Si, Jie as officials. Investigated and blamed other crimes. Qu Ji and Jie said: 'Generals and chancellors are not humiliated.' They committed suicide. Si was finally imprisoned and received the five punishments.

sentences.zh: 三年，章邯等將其卒圍鉅鹿，楚上將軍項羽將楚卒往救鉅鹿。

translations.literal: In the third year, Zhang Han and others led their soldiers to surround Julu. The Chu Supreme General Xiang Yu led Chu soldiers to go rescue Julu.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Zhang Han and others led their soldiers to surround Julu. The Chu Supreme General Xiang Yu led Chu soldiers to go rescue Julu.

sentences.zh: 冬，趙高為丞相，竟案李斯殺之。

translations.literal: In winter, Zhao Gao became chancellor and finally investigated and killed Li Si.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, Zhao Gao became chancellor and finally investigated and killed Li Si.

sentences.zh: 夏，章邯等戰數卻，二世使人讓邯，邯恐，使長史欣請事。

translations.literal: In summer, Zhang Han and others battled with several retreats. The Second Emperor sent someone to reproach Han; Han feared and had the chief clerk Xin request affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Zhang Han and others battled with several retreats. The Second Emperor sent someone to reproach Han; Han feared and had the chief clerk Xin request affairs.

sentences.zh: 趙高弗見，又弗信。

translations.literal: Zhao Gao did not see him, and moreover did not believe him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao did not see him, and moreover did not believe him.

sentences.zh: 欣恐，亡去，高使人捕追不及。

translations.literal: Xin feared and fled. Gao sent people to seize and pursue him but did not reach him.
translations.idiomatic: Xin feared and fled. Gao sent people to seize and pursue him but did not reach him.

sentences.zh: 欣見邯曰：「趙高用事於中，將軍有功亦誅，無功亦誅。」

translations.literal: Xin saw Han said: 'Zhao Gao uses affairs in middle, general has merit also executed, no merit also executed.'
translations.idiomatic: Xin saw Han and said, 'Zhao Gao controls affairs within; the general will be executed whether he has merit or not.'

sentences.zh: 項羽急擊秦軍，虜王離，邯等遂以兵降諸侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu urgently struck the Qin army, captured Wang Li, and Han and others then surrendered their troops to the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu urgently struck the Qin army, captured Wang Li, and Han and others then surrendered their troops to the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 八月己亥，趙高欲為亂，恐群臣不聽，乃先設驗，持鹿獻於二世，曰：「馬也。」

translations.literal: Eighth month Ji Hai, Zhao Gao wished make chaos, feared ministers not listen, then first set test, held deer offered to second generation, said: 'Horse also.'
translations.idiomatic: On the eighth month Jihai day, Zhao Gao wished to make chaos. Fearing the ministers would not listen, he first set a test, held a deer and offered it to the Second Emperor, saying, 'This is a horse.'

sentences.zh: 二世笑曰：「丞相誤邪？

translations.literal: Second generation laughed said: 'Chancellor mistaken ah?
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor laughed and said, 'Is the Chancellor mistaken?

sentences.zh: 謂鹿為馬。」

translations.literal: Calls deer as horse.'
translations.idiomatic: He calls a deer a horse.'

sentences.zh: 問左右，左右或默，或言馬以阿順趙高。

translations.literal: He asked the attendants; the attendants were either silent or said it was a horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao.
translations.idiomatic: He asked the attendants; the attendants were either silent or said it was a horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao.

sentences.zh: 或言鹿（者），高因陰中諸言鹿者以法。

translations.literal: Those who said it was a deer, Gao then secretly struck with the law.
translations.idiomatic: Those who said it was a deer, Gao then secretly struck with the law.

sentences.zh: 後群臣皆畏高。

translations.literal: Afterward, all the ministers feared Gao.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, all the ministers feared Gao.

translations.literal: In the third year, Zhang Han and others as generals led their soldiers to surround Julu. Chu Supreme General Xiang Yu led Chu soldiers to go rescue Julu. In winter, Zhao Gao became chancellor and finally investigated and killed Li Si. In summer, Zhang Han and others battled several retreats. The Second Generation had a person reproach Han. Han feared and had Chief Clerk Xin request affairs. Zhao Gao did not see him, moreover did not believe. Xin feared, fled and went away. Gao had people seize and pursue but did not reach him. Xin saw Han and said: 'Zhao Gao uses affairs in the middle. The general has merit and is also executed, no merit and is also executed.' Xiang Yu urgently struck the Qin army, captured Wang Li. Han and others then with troops surrendered to the feudal lords. In the eighth month on Jihai, Zhao Gao wished to make chaos. Feared the ministers would not listen. He then first set a test, held a deer and offered it to the Second Generation, saying: 'A horse also.' The Second Generation laughed, saying: 'Chancellor mistaken? Calls a deer a horse.' He asked the attendants. The attendants were either silent, or said horse to flatter and follow Zhao Gao. Or those who said deer, Gao then secretly struck various who said deer with the law. After that, the ministers all feared Gao.

sentences.zh: 高前數言「關東盜毋能為也」，及項羽虜秦將王離等鉅鹿下而前，章邯等軍數卻，上書請益助，燕、趙、齊、楚、韓、魏皆立為王，自關以東，大氐盡畔秦吏應諸侯，諸侯咸率其眾西鄉。

translations.literal: Gao previously several times said 'Guan east robbers not able do also', and Xiang Yu captured Qin general Wang Li etc. Julu below and advanced, Zhang Han etc. army several retreats, memorialed requested additional aid, Yan Zhao Qi Chu Han Wei all established as kings, from pass east, greatly all rebelled Qin officials responded feudal lords, feudal lords all led their multitudes west faced.
translations.idiomatic: Gao had previously said several times, 'The robbers east of the pass cannot do anything,' but Xiang Yu captured Qin generals Wang Li and others below Julu and advanced. Zhang Han and others' army retreated several times, memorialized requesting additional aid. Yan, Zhao, Qi, Chu, Han, and Wei all established themselves as kings. From the pass eastward, for the most part all rebelled against Qin officials and responded to the feudal lords. The feudal lords all led their multitudes and faced west.

sentences.zh: 沛公將數萬人已屠武關，使人私於高，高恐二世怒，誅及其身，乃謝病不朝見。

translations.literal: Duke Pei, leading several tens of thousands of people, had already slaughtered Wuguan. He sent someone privately to Gao. Gao feared the Second Emperor would be angered and the execution would reach his person, so he declined illness and did not attend morning audiences.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Pei, leading several tens of thousands of people, had already slaughtered Wuguan. He sent someone privately to Gao. Gao feared the Second Emperor would be angered and the execution would reach his person, so he declined illness and did not attend morning audiences.

sentences.zh: 二世夢白虎齧其左驂馬，殺之，心不樂，怪問占夢。

translations.literal: The Second Emperor dreamed that a white tiger bit his left trace horse. He killed it; his heart was not happy. He strangely asked for the dream to be interpreted.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor dreamed that a white tiger bit his left trace horse. He killed it; his heart was not happy. He strangely asked for the dream to be interpreted.

sentences.zh: 卜曰：「涇水為祟。」

translations.literal: Diviner said: 'Jing water makes evil spirit.'
translations.idiomatic: The diviner said, 'The Jing River is causing evil.'

sentences.zh: 二世乃齋於望夷宮，欲祠涇，沈四白馬。

translations.literal: The Second Emperor then purified himself at the Wangyi Palace, wished to sacrifice to the Jing, and sank four white horses.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor then purified himself at the Wangyi Palace, wished to sacrifice to the Jing, and sank four white horses.

sentences.zh: 使使責讓高以盜賊事。

translations.literal: He sent an envoy to reproach Gao with the robber and bandit matters.
translations.idiomatic: He sent an envoy to reproach Gao with the robber and bandit matters.

sentences.zh: 高懼，乃陰與其婿咸陽令閻樂、其弟趙成謀曰：「上不聽諫，今事急，欲歸禍於吾宗。

translations.literal: Gao feared, then secretly with his son-in-law Xianyang magistrate Yan Le, his younger brother Zhao Cheng plotted said: 'His Majesty not listens remonstrations, now affairs urgent, wishes return calamity to my clan.
translations.idiomatic: Gao feared, and then secretly plotted with his son-in-law Yan Le, the Xianyang magistrate, and his younger brother Zhao Cheng, saying, 'His Majesty does not listen to remonstrations. Now affairs are urgent; he wishes to return calamity to my clan.

sentences.zh: 吾欲易置上，更立公子嬰。

translations.literal: I wish to change and place His Majesty, and moreover establish Prince Ying.
translations.idiomatic: I wish to change and place His Majesty, and moreover establish Prince Ying.

sentences.zh: 子嬰仁儉，百姓皆載其言。」

translations.literal: Zi Ying benevolent frugal, common people all carry his words.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying is benevolent and frugal; the common people all carry his words.'

sentences.zh: 使郎中令為內應，詐為有大賊，令樂召吏發卒，追劫樂母置高舍。

translations.literal: He made the palace attendant commander as inner response, deceived into making it seem there were great robbers, commanded Le to summon officials and dispatch soldiers, and pursued and robbed Le's mother, placing her in Gao's residence.
translations.idiomatic: He made the palace attendant commander as inner response, deceived into making it seem there were great robbers, commanded Le to summon officials and dispatch soldiers, and pursued and robbed Le's mother, placing her in Gao's residence.

sentences.zh: 遣樂將吏卒千餘人至望夷宮殿門，縛衛令仆射，曰：「賊入此，何不止？」

translations.literal: Dispatched Le generals officials soldiers thousand more people to Wang Yi palace hall gate, bound guard commander deputy, said: 'Robbers entered here, why not stopped?'
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched Le to lead over a thousand officials and soldiers to the Wangyi Palace hall gate, bound the guard commander's deputy, and said, 'Robbers entered here—why were they not stopped?'

sentences.zh: 衛令曰：「周廬設卒甚謹，安得賊敢入宮？」

translations.literal: Guard commander said: 'Surrounding huts set soldiers very careful, how obtained robbers dared enter palace?'
translations.idiomatic: The guard commander said, 'The surrounding huts have soldiers set very carefully—how could robbers dare enter the palace?'

sentences.zh: 樂遂斬衛令，直將吏入，行射，郎宦者大驚，或走或格，格者輒死，死者數十人。

translations.literal: Le then beheaded the guard commander, straightaway led the officials and entered, advanced shooting. The gentlemen and eunuchs were greatly startled; some fled, some resisted—the resisters then died. Those who died were several tens of people.
translations.idiomatic: Le then beheaded the guard commander, straightaway led the officials and entered, advanced shooting. The gentlemen and eunuchs were greatly startled; some fled, some resisted—the resisters then died. Those who died were several tens of people.

sentences.zh: 郎中令與樂俱入，射上幄坐幃。

translations.literal: The palace attendant commander entered together with Le and shot at His Majesty's canopy, seat, and curtains.
translations.idiomatic: The palace attendant commander entered together with Le and shot at His Majesty's canopy, seat, and curtains.

sentences.zh: 二世怒，召左右，左右皆惶擾不鬬。

translations.literal: The Second Emperor was angered and summoned his attendants; the attendants were all panicked and disturbed and did not fight.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was angered and summoned his attendants; the attendants were all panicked and disturbed and did not fight.

sentences.zh: 旁有宦者一人，侍不敢去。

translations.literal: Beside him there was one eunuch who served and did not dare leave.
translations.idiomatic: Beside him there was one eunuch who served and did not dare leave.

sentences.zh: 二世入內，謂曰：「公何不蚤告我？

translations.literal: Second generation entered inner, said to him: 'You why not early told me?
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor entered within and said to him, 'Why did you not early tell me?

sentences.zh: 乃至於此！」

translations.literal: Reached to this!'
translations.idiomatic: It has reached to this!'

sentences.zh: 宦者曰：「臣不敢言，故得全。

translations.literal: Eunuch said: 'Minister not dared speak, therefore obtained wholeness.
translations.idiomatic: The eunuch said, 'Your minister did not dare speak, therefore obtained wholeness.

sentences.zh: 使臣蚤言，皆已誅，安得至今？」

translations.literal: Made minister early speak, all already executed, how obtained until now?'
translations.idiomatic: If made your minister speak early, all would already be executed—how obtained until now?'

sentences.zh: 閻樂前即二世數曰：「足下驕恣，誅殺無道，天下共畔足下，足下其自為計。」

translations.literal: Yan Le advanced approached second generation reproached said: 'You arrogant unrestrained, executed killed without way, world together rebelled you, you should self make plan.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Le advanced and approached the Second Emperor, reproached and said, 'You are arrogant and unrestrained, execute and kill without way. The world together rebels against you; you should make your own plan.'

sentences.zh: 二世曰：「丞相可得見否？」

translations.literal: Second generation said: 'Chancellor can be seen not?'
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said, 'Can the Chancellor be seen?'

sentences.zh: 樂曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: Le said: 'Not possible.'
translations.idiomatic: Le said, 'Not possible.'

sentences.zh: 二世曰：「吾願得一郡為王。」

translations.literal: Second generation said: 'I wish obtain one commandery as king.'
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor said, 'I wish to obtain one commandery to be king.'

sentences.zh: 弗許。

translations.literal: It was not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: It was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 又曰：「願為萬戶侯。」

translations.literal: Again said: 'Wish be ten thousand households marquis.'
translations.idiomatic: He again said, 'I wish to be a marquis of ten thousand households.'

sentences.zh: 弗許。

translations.literal: It was not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: It was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 曰：「願與妻子為黔首，比諸公子。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Wish with wife children be qian shou, compare various princes.'
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'I wish with my wife and children to be common people, comparable to the various princes.'

sentences.zh: 閻樂曰：「臣受命於丞相，為天下誅足下，足下雖多言，臣不敢報。」

translations.literal: Yan Le said: 'Minister received command from chancellor, for world execute you, you though many words, minister not dares report.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Le said, 'Your minister received command from the chancellor to execute you for the world. Though you have many words, your minister does not dare report.'

sentences.zh: 麾其兵進。

translations.literal: He waved his troops to advance.
translations.idiomatic: He waved his troops to advance.

sentences.zh: 二世自殺。

translations.literal: The Second Emperor committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor committed suicide.

translations.literal: Gao had previously several times said 'East of the pass robbers are not able to do anything', and Xiang Yu captured Qin general Wang Li and others below Julu and advanced. Zhang Han and others' army several retreats. They memorialed requesting additional aid. Yan, Zhao, Qi, Chu, Han, Wei all established as kings. From east of the pass, for the most part all rebelled against Qin officials and responded to the feudal lords. The feudal lords all led their multitudes facing west. Pei Gong as general with several ten thousand people had already slaughtered Wuguan. He had a person privately approach Gao. Gao feared the Second Generation would anger and execute, reaching his person. He then declined illness and did not have morning audiences. The Second Generation dreamed a white tiger bit his left trace horse and killed it. His heart was not happy. He strangely asked for dream interpretation. The diviner said: 'The Jing water makes an evil spirit.' The Second Generation then purified at Wangyi Palace, wished to sacrifice to the Jing, and sank four white horses. He had an envoy reproach Gao with robber and bandit matters. Gao feared, then secretly plotted with his son-in-law Xianyang magistrate Yan Le and his younger brother Zhao Cheng, saying: 'His Majesty does not listen to remonstrations. Now affairs are urgent. He wishes to return calamity to my clan. I wish to change and place His Majesty, moreover establish Prince Ying. Zi Ying is benevolent and frugal. The common people all carry his words.' He had the Palace Attendant Commander as inner response, deceived by making as if there were great robbers. He commanded Le to summon officials and dispatch soldiers, pursue and rob Le's mother and place her in Gao's residence. He dispatched Le as general with officials and soldiers over a thousand people to Wangyi Palace hall gate. They bound the guard commander and deputy, saying: 'Robbers entered here. Why did you not stop them?' The guard commander said: 'The surrounding huts have soldiers set very carefully. How did robbers dare enter the palace?' Le then beheaded the guard commander, straight led officials entered, advanced shooting. The gentlemen and eunuchs were greatly startled. Some fled, some resisted. Those who resisted then died. Those who died were several tens of people. The Palace Attendant Commander with Le together entered and shot at His Majesty's canopy and seat curtains. The Second Generation angered, summoned the attendants. The attendants were all panicked and disturbed, did not fight. Beside there was one eunuch who served and did not dare leave. The Second Generation entered the inner quarters and said to him: 'Why did you not early tell me? It has reached to this!' The eunuch said: 'I, your minister, did not dare speak, therefore obtained wholeness. If they had made me, your minister, speak early, all would already be executed. How would I have obtained until now?' Yan Le advanced and approached the Second Generation, reproached him saying: 'You are arrogant and unrestrained, execute and kill without way. The world together rebels against you. You should make a plan for yourself.' The Second Generation said: 'Can the chancellor be seen?' Le said: 'Not possible.' The Second Generation said: 'I wish to obtain one commandery as king.' Not permitted. He again said: 'Wish to be a ten thousand households marquis.' Not permitted. He said: 'Wish with wife and children to be qianshou, compare to the various princes.' Yan Le said: 'I, your minister, received command from the chancellor, to execute you for the world. Though you have many words, I do not dare report.' He waved his troops to advance. The Second Generation committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 閻樂歸報趙高，趙高乃悉召諸大臣公子，告以誅二世之狀。

translations.literal: Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao. Zhao Gao then completely summoned the various ministers and princes, and told them of the circumstances of executing the Second Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao. Zhao Gao then completely summoned the various ministers and princes, and told them of the circumstances of executing the Second Emperor.

sentences.zh: 曰：「秦故王國，始皇君天下，故稱帝。

translations.literal: Said: 'Qin former kingdom, beginning emperor ruled world, therefore called emperor.
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'Qin was formerly a kingdom; the First Emperor ruled the world, therefore called emperor.

sentences.zh: 今六國復自立，秦地益小，乃以空名為帝，不可。

translations.literal: Now the six states have again established themselves; Qin lands are increasingly small. To be emperor with an empty name is not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Now the six states have again established themselves; Qin lands are increasingly small. To be emperor with an empty name is not possible.

sentences.zh: 宜為王如故，便。」

translations.literal: Proper be king as before, convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: It is proper to be king as before; convenient.'

sentences.zh: 立二世之兄子公子嬰為秦王。

translations.literal: They established the Second Emperor's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as Qin king.
translations.idiomatic: They established the Second Emperor's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as Qin king.

sentences.zh: 以黔首葬二世杜南宜春苑中。

translations.literal: They used common people to bury the Second Emperor in the Yichun Park south of Du.
translations.idiomatic: They used common people to bury the Second Emperor in the Yichun Park south of Du.

sentences.zh: 令子嬰齋，當廟見，受王璽。

translations.literal: They commanded Zi Ying to purify himself, should see in the temple, and receive the king's seal.
translations.idiomatic: They commanded Zi Ying to purify himself, should see in the temple, and receive the king's seal.

sentences.zh: 齋五日，子嬰與其子二人謀曰：「丞相高殺二世望夷宮，恐群臣誅之，乃詳以義立我。

translations.literal: Purified five days, Zi Ying with his sons two people plotted said: 'Chancellor Gao killed second generation Wang Yi palace, feared ministers execute him, then pretended with righteousness established me.
translations.idiomatic: He purified for five days. Zi Ying plotted with his two sons, saying, 'Chancellor Gao killed the Second Emperor in the Wangyi Palace. Fearing the ministers would execute him, he then pretended with righteousness to establish me.

sentences.zh: 我聞趙高乃與楚約，滅秦宗室而王關中。

translations.literal: I heard that Zhao Gao then agreed with Chu to extinguish the Qin clan residence and be king in Guanzhong.
translations.idiomatic: I heard that Zhao Gao then agreed with Chu to extinguish the Qin clan residence and be king in Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 今使我齋見廟，此欲因廟中殺我。

translations.literal: Now he makes me purify and see the temple—this wishes to take advantage of the temple to kill me.
translations.idiomatic: Now he makes me purify and see the temple—this wishes to take advantage of the temple to kill me.

sentences.zh: 我稱病不行，丞相必自來，來則殺之。」

translations.literal: I claim illness not go, chancellor certainly self come, come then kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: I will claim illness and not go; the chancellor will certainly come himself, and when he comes, we will kill him.'

sentences.zh: 高使人請子嬰數輩，子嬰不行，高果自往，曰：「宗廟重事，王柰何不行？」

translations.literal: Gao made person invite Zi Ying several times, Zi Ying not went, Gao indeed self went, said: 'Clan temple heavy matters, king why not go?'
translations.idiomatic: Gao had people invite Zi Ying several times, Zi Ying did not go, Gao indeed went himself, saying: 'Clan temple heavy matters, king why not go?'

sentences.zh: 子嬰遂刺殺高於齋宮，三族高家以徇咸陽。

translations.literal: Zi Ying then stabbed killed Gao at purification palace, three clans Gao family to display Xianyang.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying then stabbed and killed Gao at the purification palace, three-clanned Gao's family to display in Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 子嬰為秦王四十六日，楚將沛公破秦軍入武關，遂至霸上，使人約降子嬰。

translations.literal: Zi Ying was Qin king forty-six days, Chu general Pei Gong broke Qin army entered Wu Guan, then reached Ba Shang, made person agreed surrender Zi Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying was Qin king for forty-six days, Chu general Pei Gong broke the Qin army and entered Wu Guan, then reached Ba Shang, and sent someone to arrange Zi Ying's surrender.

sentences.zh: 子嬰即系頸以組，白馬素車，奉天子璽符，降軹道旁。

translations.literal: Zi Ying immediately tied neck with cord, white horse plain carriage, offered emperor seal talisman, surrendered Zhi road side.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying immediately tied his neck with a cord, white horse plain carriage, offered the emperor's seal and talisman, surrendered by the side of Zhi road.

sentences.zh: 沛公遂入咸陽，封宮室府庫，還軍霸上。

translations.literal: Pei Gong then entered Xianyang, sealed palace chambers treasuries storehouses, returned army Ba Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong then entered Xianyang, sealed the palace chambers, treasuries, and storehouses, and returned his army to Ba Shang.

sentences.zh: 居月餘，諸侯兵至，項籍為從長，殺子嬰及秦諸公子宗族。

translations.literal: Resided month more, feudal lords troops arrived, Xiang Ji was alliance leader, killed Zi Ying and Qin various princes clan residence.
translations.idiomatic: After residing more than a month, the feudal lords' troops arrived, Xiang Ji was the alliance leader, and killed Zi Ying and the Qin various princes and clan residence.

sentences.zh: 遂屠咸陽，燒其宮室，虜其子女，收其珍寶貨財，諸侯共分之。

translations.literal: Then slaughtered Xianyang, burned its palace chambers, captured its sons daughters, collected its precious treasures goods wealth, feudal lords together divided them.
translations.idiomatic: Then slaughtered Xianyang, burned its palace chambers, captured its sons and daughters, collected its precious treasures, goods, and wealth, which the feudal lords together divided.

sentences.zh: 滅秦之後，各分其地為三，名曰雍王、塞王、翟王，號曰三秦。

translations.literal: Extinguished Qin after, each divided its land as three, named Yong king, Sai king, Di king, titled three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: After extinguishing Qin, each divided its land into three, named Yong king, Sai king, Di king, titled the Three Qin.

sentences.zh: 項羽為西楚霸王，主命分天下王諸侯，秦竟滅矣。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu became west Chu overlord king, chief commanded divided world king feudal lords, Qin finally extinguished already.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu became the West Chu Overlord King, chiefly commanded the division of the world to enfeoff kings among the feudal lords, and Qin was finally extinguished.

sentences.zh: 後五年，天下定於漢。

translations.literal: Later five years, world settled at Han.
translations.idiomatic: Five years later, the world was settled under Han.

translations.literal: Yan Le returned and reported to Zhao Gao. Zhao Gao then completely summoned the various ministers and princes, told them of the circumstances of executing the Second Generation. He said: 'Qin was formerly a kingdom. The Beginning Emperor ruled the world, therefore was called emperor. Now the six states again self-established. Qin land is increasingly small. To be emperor with an empty name is not possible. It is proper to be king as before. Convenient.' They established the Second Generation's elder brother's son, Prince Ying, as Qin king. They used qianshou to bury the Second Generation in the Yichun Park south of Du. They commanded Zi Ying to purify, should see in the temple, receive the king seal. He purified for five days. Zi Ying plotted with his two sons, saying: 'Chancellor Gao killed the Second Generation in Wangyi Palace. He feared the ministers would execute him. He then pretended with righteousness to establish me. I heard that Zhao Gao then agreed with Chu to extinguish the Qin clan residence and become king of Guanzhong. Now they make me purify and see the temple. This wishes to take advantage in the temple to kill me. I will claim illness and not go. The chancellor will certainly come himself. When he comes, then kill him.' Gao had a person invite Zi Ying several times. Zi Ying did not go. Gao indeed went himself, saying: 'Clan temple heavy matters. Why does the king not go?' Zi Ying then stabbed and killed Gao at the purification palace. He three-clanned Gao's family to display at Xianyang. Zi Ying was Qin king for forty-six days. Chu general Pei Gong broke the Qin army and entered Wuguan, then reached Bashang. He had a person agree on Zi Ying's surrender. Zi Ying immediately tied his neck with a cord, white horse and plain carriage, offered the emperor seal and talisman, surrendered at the roadside of Zhi. Pei Gong then entered Xianyang, sealed the palace chambers and treasuries storehouses, returned the army to Bashang. He resided more than a month. The feudal lords' troops arrived. Xiang Ji was the alliance leader. He killed Zi Ying and the Qin various princes and clan residence. He then slaughtered Xianyang, burned its palace chambers, captured its sons and daughters, collected its precious treasures and goods wealth. The feudal lords together divided them. After extinguishing Qin, each divided its land as three, named Yong king, Sai king, Di king, titled the three Qin. Xiang Yu became the west Chu overlord king, chief commanded to divide the world and king the feudal lords. Qin was finally extinguished. Five years later, the world was settled at Han.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先伯翳，嘗有勳於唐虞之際，受土賜姓。

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Qin ancestors Bo Yi, once had merit at Tang Yu between, received land granted surname.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Qin's ancestor Bo Yi once had merit during the time between Tang and Yu, received land and was granted a surname.

sentences.zh: 及殷夏之閒微散。

translations.literal: And Yin Xia between slightly scattered.
translations.idiomatic: And between Yin and Xia they slightly scattered.

sentences.zh: 至周之衰，秦興，邑于西垂。

translations.literal: Reached Zhou decline, Qin rose, established city at west border.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou declined, Qin rose and established a city at the western border.

sentences.zh: 自繆公以來，稍蠶食諸侯，竟成始皇。

translations.literal: From Mu gong since, gradually nibbled feudal lords, finally became beginning emperor.
translations.idiomatic: From Duke Mu onward, they gradually nibbled away at the feudal lords, finally becoming the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 始皇自以為功過五帝，地廣三王，而羞與之侔。

translations.literal: Beginning emperor self thought merit surpassed five emperors, land broad three kings, but ashamed match them.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor himself thought his merit surpassed the Five Emperors, his land broader than the Three Kings, but was ashamed to match them.

sentences.zh: 善哉乎賈生推言之也！

translations.literal: Good indeed Jia Sheng expounded spoke it!
translations.idiomatic: How well Jia Sheng expounded and spoke of it!

sentences.zh: 曰：

translations.literal: Said:
translations.idiomatic: Said:

And between Yin and Xia they slightly scattered. When Zhou declined, Qin rose, established a city at the west border. From Duke Mu since, they gradually nibbled at the feudal lords, finally became the Beginning Emperor. The Beginning Emperor himself thought his merit surpassed the five emperors, his land broader than the three kings, but was ashamed to match them. Good indeed how Jia Sheng expounded and spoke of it! He said:

sentences.zh: 秦并兼諸侯山東三十餘郡，繕津關，據險塞，修甲兵而守之。

translations.literal: Qin united annexed feudal lords east mountains thirty more commanderies, repaired ford passes, occupied dangerous barriers, repaired armored soldiers guarded them.
translations.idiomatic: Qin united and annexed the feudal lords east of the mountains in thirty more commanderies, repaired the ford passes, occupied the dangerous barriers, repaired the armored soldiers and guarded them.

sentences.zh: 然陳涉以戍卒散亂之眾數百，奮臂大呼，不用弓戟之兵，鉏櫌白梃，望屋而食，橫行天下。

translations.literal: However Chen She with garrison soldiers scattered disordered multitudes several hundred, raised arms great called, not used bow halberd soldiers, hoes rakes white clubs, gazed houses ate, horizontal traveled world.
translations.idiomatic: However Chen She with several hundred scattered and disordered garrison soldiers, raised his arms and called out greatly, not using bow or halberd soldiers, hoes, rakes, white clubs, gazed at houses and ate, horizontally traveled the world.

sentences.zh: 秦人阻險不守，關梁不闔，長戟不刺，彊弩不射。

translations.literal: Qin people blocked dangers not guarded, passes bridges not closed, long halberds not stabbed, strong crossbows not shot.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin people did not guard the blocked dangers, did not close the passes and bridges, did not stab with long halberds, did not shoot with strong crossbows.

sentences.zh: 楚師深入，戰於鴻門，曾無藩籬之艱。

translations.literal: Chu armies deeply entered, battled at Hong Men, once had no fence hedge difficulties.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu armies deeply entered, battled at Hong Men, once had no fence or hedge difficulties.

sentences.zh: 於是山東大擾，諸侯并起，豪俊相立。

translations.literal: Thereupon east mountains greatly disturbed, feudal lords together rose, heroes outstanding mutually established.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon east of the mountains was greatly disturbed, the feudal lords together rose, heroes and outstanding men mutually established themselves.

sentences.zh: 秦使章邯將而東征，章邯因以三軍之眾要市於外，以謀其上。

translations.literal: Qin made Zhang Han general east campaign, Zhang Han then with three armies multitudes demanded ransom outside, to plot his superiors.
translations.idiomatic: Qin made Zhang Han general for the eastern campaign, Zhang Han then with the multitudes of the three armies demanded ransom outside, to plot against his superiors.

sentences.zh: 群臣之不信，可見於此矣。

translations.literal: Ministers not trustworthy, can be seen at this already.
translations.idiomatic: That the ministers were not trustworthy can be seen from this.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立，遂不寤。

translations.literal: Zi Ying established, then not awoke.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying was established, then did not awaken.

sentences.zh: 藉使子嬰有庸主之材，僅得中佐，山東雖亂，秦之地可全而有，宗廟之祀未當絕也。

translations.literal: Suppose Zi Ying had ordinary lord materials, merely obtained middle assistants, east mountains though chaotic, Qin land could whole have, clan temple sacrifices not should extinguished also.
translations.idiomatic: Suppose Zi Ying had the materials of an ordinary lord, merely obtained middle assistants, east of the mountains though chaotic, Qin land could be wholly preserved, clan temple sacrifices should not have been extinguished.

translations.literal: Qin united and annexed the feudal lords east of the mountains thirty more commanderies, repaired the ford passes, occupied the dangerous barriers, repaired the armored soldiers and guarded them. However Chen She with garrison soldiers' scattered and disordered multitudes of several hundred, raised arms and greatly called, did not use bow and halberd soldiers, hoes rakes and white clubs, gazed at houses and ate, horizontally traveled the world.
