The Chu armies deeply entered, battled at Hongmen, once had no fence and hedge difficulties. Thereupon east of the mountains was greatly disturbed, feudal lords together rose, heroes and outstanding ones mutually established. Qin made Zhang Han general for the east campaign. Zhang Han then with the three armies' multitudes demanded ransom outside, to plot against his superiors. The ministers' lack of trustworthiness can be seen from this. Zi Ying was established, then did not awake. Suppose Zi Ying had ordinary lord's materials, merely obtained middle assistants, though east of mountains was chaotic, Qin's land could be whole and had, the clan temple sacrifices should not have been extinguished.

sentences.zh: 秦地被山帶河以為固，四塞之國也。

translations.literal: Qin land covered mountains girded rivers as solid, four barriers country also.
translations.idiomatic: Qin land was covered by mountains and girded by rivers as solid, a country of four barriers.

sentences.zh: 自繆公以來，至於秦王，二十餘君，常為諸侯雄。

translations.literal: From Mu gong since, reached Qin king, twenty more lords, constantly were feudal lords hero.
translations.idiomatic: From Duke Mu onward, reaching the Qin king, twenty more lords constantly were the hero of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 豈世世賢哉？

translations.literal: How generation generation worthy ah?
translations.idiomatic: How could generation after generation be worthy?

sentences.zh: 其勢居然也。

translations.literal: Their situation obviously also.
translations.idiomatic: Their situation was obviously so.

sentences.zh: 且天下嘗同心并力而攻秦矣。

translations.literal: Moreover world once united hearts united strength attacked Qin already.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover the world once united hearts and united strength to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 當此之世，賢智并列，良將行其師，賢相通其謀，然困於阻險而不能進，秦乃延入戰而為之開關，百萬之徒逃北而遂壞。

translations.literal: At this time, worthy wise parallel arrayed, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans, however trapped by blocked dangers could not advance, Qin then lured them battle opened passes, million multitudes fled north then destroyed.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the worthy and wise were arrayed in parallel, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans, however they were trapped by blocked dangers and could not advance, Qin then lured them into battle and opened the passes for them, million multitudes fled north and were then destroyed.

sentences.zh: 豈勇力智慧不足哉？

translations.literal: How courage strength wisdom insufficient ah?
translations.idiomatic: How could courage, strength, and wisdom be insufficient?

sentences.zh: 形不利，勢不便也。

translations.literal: Form unfavorable, situation inconvenient also.
translations.idiomatic: The form was unfavorable, the situation inconvenient.

sentences.zh: 秦小邑并大城，守險塞而軍，高壘毋戰，閉關據阨，荷戟而守之。

translations.literal: Qin small cities united large cities, guarded dangerous barriers stationed armies, high ramparts not battle, closed passes occupied defiles, carried halberds guarded them.
translations.idiomatic: Qin united small cities into large cities, guarded the dangerous barriers and stationed armies, high ramparts did not battle, closed passes occupied defiles, carried halberds and guarded them.

sentences.zh: 諸侯起於匹夫，以利合，非有素王之行也。

translations.literal: Feudal lords rose from common men, with profit united, not had prepared king conduct also.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords rose from common men, united by profit, did not have the conduct of prepared kings.

sentences.zh: 其交未親，其下未附，名為亡秦，其實利之也。

translations.literal: Their relations not close, their below not attached, named perished Qin, actually profited it also.
translations.idiomatic: Their relations were not close, their subordinates not attached, named perished Qin, actually profited from it.

sentences.zh: 彼見秦阻之難犯也，必退師。

translations.literal: They saw Qin barriers difficult violate also, certainly retreated armies.
translations.idiomatic: They saw that Qin's barriers were difficult to violate, certainly retreated their armies.

sentences.zh: 安土息民，以待其敝，收弱扶罷，以令大國之君，不患不得意於海內。

translations.literal: Pacified land rested people, to await their exhaustion, gathered weak supported tired, to command great countries lords, not worried not obtained intention within seas.
translations.idiomatic: Pacified the land and rested the people, to await their exhaustion, gathered the weak and supported the tired, to command the lords of great countries, not worried about not obtaining intention within the seas.

sentences.zh: 貴為天子，富有天下，而身為禽者，其救敗非也。

translations.literal: Noble as emperor, rich had world, but body became prey ones, their rescue defeat wrong also.
translations.idiomatic: Though noble as emperor and rich with the world, their bodies became prey—their rescue of defeat was wrong.

translations.literal: Qin's land was covered by mountains and girded by rivers as solid fortifications. It was a country of four barriers. From Duke Mu since, to the Qin king, twenty more lords constantly were the feudal lords' hero. How were they worthy generation after generation? Their situation was obviously so. Moreover the world once united hearts and united strength to attack Qin. At this time, worthy and wise were parallel arrayed, good generals marched their armies, worthy chancellors communicated their plans. However they were trapped by blocked dangers and could not advance. Qin then lured them into battle and opened the passes. The million multitudes fled north and were then destroyed. How was courage, strength, and wisdom insufficient? The form was unfavorable, the situation inconvenient. Qin united small cities into large cities, guarded dangerous barriers and stationed armies, high ramparts did not battle, closed passes and occupied defiles, carried halberds and guarded them. The feudal lords rose from common men, united by profit, did not have prepared king conduct. Their relations were not close, their below were not attached. They were named as perishing Qin, but actually profited from it. They saw Qin's barriers were difficult to violate, certainly retreated their armies. They pacified the land and rested the people, to await their exhaustion, gathered the weak and supported the tired, to command the great countries' lords. They were not worried about not obtaining their intention within the seas. Noble as emperor, rich and had the world, but the body became prey. Their rescue of defeat was wrong.

sentences.zh: 秦王足己不問，遂過而不變。

translations.literal: Qin king satisfied self not asked, then erred not changed.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king was satisfied with himself and did not ask, then erred and did not change.

sentences.zh: 二世受之，因而不改，暴虐以重禍。

translations.literal: Second generation received it, followed not changed, violent cruel to increase calamities.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor received it, followed without changing, violent and cruel to increase calamities.

sentences.zh: 子嬰孤立無親，危弱無輔。

translations.literal: Zi Ying isolated no relatives, dangerous weak no assistants.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying was isolated without relatives, dangerous and weak without assistants.

sentences.zh: 三主惑而終身不悟，亡，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: Three lords confused lifelong not awoke, perished, not also proper ah?
translations.idiomatic: The three lords were confused and lifelong did not awaken, perished—was this not proper?

sentences.zh: 當此時也，世非無深慮知化之士也，然所以不敢盡忠拂過者，秦俗多忌諱之禁，忠言未卒於口而身為戮沒矣。

translations.literal: At this time, world not without deep thought knew change scholars also, however what dared not exhaust loyalty opposed faults ones, Qin customs many taboo prohibitions, loyal words not finished in mouth body became executed drowned already.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the world was not without scholars of deep thought who knew change, however those who dared not exhaust loyalty and oppose faults, Qin customs had many taboo prohibitions—loyal words were not finished in the mouth when the body became executed and drowned.

sentences.zh: 故使天下之士，傾耳而聽，重足而立，拑口而不言。

translations.literal: Therefore made world scholars, inclined ears listened, heavy feet stood, shut mouths not spoke.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it made the world's scholars incline their ears and listen, stand with heavy feet, shut their mouths and not speak.

sentences.zh: 是以三主失道，忠臣不敢諫，智士不敢謀，天下已亂，姦不上聞，豈不哀哉！

translations.literal: Therefore three lords lost way, loyal ministers not dared remonstrate, wise scholars not dared plan, world already chaotic, evil not up heard, how not sorrowful ah!
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the three rulers lost the way; loyal ministers dared not remonstrate, wise men dared not plan. The world was already in chaos, evil was not reported upward—how could this not be sorrowful!

sentences.zh: 先王知雍蔽之傷國也，故置公卿大夫士，以飾法設刑，而天下治。

translations.literal: Former kings knew that blocking and obstructing harmed the country, therefore they established nobles, grand masters, and scholars to adorn the laws and set punishments, and the world was governed.
translations.idiomatic: Former kings knew that blocking and obstructing harmed the country, therefore they established nobles, grand masters, and scholars to adorn the laws and set punishments, and the world was governed.

sentences.zh: 其彊也，禁暴誅亂而天下服。

translations.literal: When they were strong, they prohibited violence, executed chaos, and the world submitted.
translations.idiomatic: When they were strong, they prohibited violence, executed chaos, and the world submitted.

sentences.zh: 其弱也，五伯征而諸侯從。

translations.literal: When they were weak, the Five Hegemons campaigned and the feudal lords followed.
translations.idiomatic: When they were weak, the Five Hegemons campaigned and the feudal lords followed.

sentences.zh: 其削也，內守外附而社稷存。

translations.literal: When they were reduced, they guarded internally and attached externally, and the altars of soil and grain were preserved.
translations.idiomatic: When they were reduced, they guarded internally and attached externally, and the altars of soil and grain were preserved.

sentences.zh: 故秦之盛也，繁法嚴刑而天下振；

translations.literal: Therefore Qin prosperity also, numerous laws strict punishments and world shook;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when Qin prospered, numerous laws and strict punishments shook the world;

sentences.zh: 及其衰也，百姓怨望而海內畔矣。

translations.literal: when it declined, the common people resented and hoped, and within the seas they rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: When it declined, the common people resented and hoped, and within the seas they rebelled.

sentences.zh: 故周五序得其道，而千餘歲不絕。

translations.literal: Sad indeed! What made the Qin house lose the world was none other than the laws being too dense and punishments too severe.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Zhou, through the Five Orders, obtained the way, and more than a thousand years did not end.

sentences.zh: 秦本末并失，故不長久。

translations.literal: Although the First Emperor unified the world with strength, he did not change the Qin customs.
translations.idiomatic: Qin lost both root and branch, therefore did not last long.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，安危之統相去遠矣。

translations.literal: The Second Emperor followed the same path, increasing the oppression.
translations.idiomatic: From this it can be seen that the principles of safety and danger are far apart.

sentences.zh: 野諺曰「前事之不忘，後事之師也」。

translations.literal: Rural proverb said 'former matters not forget, later matters teacher also'.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the people could not bear it and rose up together.

sentences.zh: 是以君子為國，觀之上古，驗之當世，參以人事，察盛衰之理，審權勢之宜，去就有序，變化有時，故曠日長久而社稷安矣。

translations.literal: This is like tying a tiger with a rope and then releasing it—how could it not be dangerous?
translations.idiomatic: Therefore gentlemen governing the country observe the highest antiquity, verify in the present age, consult with human affairs, observe the principles of flourishing and decline, carefully consider the appropriateness of power and influence, depart and remain in order, change at the proper time, therefore days are broad and long and the altars of soil and grain are secure.

translations.literal: The Qin king was satisfied with himself and did not ask, then erred and did not change. The Second Generation received it, followed and did not change, violent and cruel to increase calamities. Zi Ying was isolated with no relatives, dangerous and weak with no assistants. The three lords were confused and lifelong did not awake. They perished. Was this not also proper? At this time, the world was not without deep-thinking scholars who knew change. However those who dared not exhaust loyalty and oppose faults, Qin customs had many taboo prohibitions. Loyal words were not finished in the mouth when the body became executed and drowned. Therefore it made the world's scholars incline their ears and listen, stand with heavy feet, shut their mouths and not speak. Therefore the three lords lost the way, loyal ministers did not dare remonstrate, wise scholars did not dare plan. The world was already chaotic, evil was not heard above. How was this not sorrowful! Former kings knew that blocking and obstructing harmed the country. Therefore they established nobles, grand masters, and scholars to adorn laws and set punishments, and the world was governed. When they were strong, they prohibited violence and executed chaos, and the world submitted. When they were weak, the five hegemons campaigned and the feudal lords followed. When they were reduced, inner guarded and outer attached, and the altars of earth existed. Therefore when Qin prospered, numerous laws and strict punishments made the world shake; When it reached their decline, the common people resented and hoped, and within the seas rebelled. Therefore Zhou's five sequences obtained their way, and a thousand more years did not extinguish. Qin's root and end were both lost, therefore not long lasting. From this observed, the succession of peace and danger were far apart. The rural proverb says: 'Not forgetting former matters is the teacher of later matters.' Therefore superior men for the country observe ancient times, verify the current world, reference with human affairs, examine prosperity and decline principles, carefully weigh power and influence propriety, leaving and taking have order, changes have their time. Therefore broad days long lasting and the altars of earth are peaceful.

sentences.zh: 秦孝公據殽函之固，擁雍州之地，君臣固守而窺周室，有席卷天下，包舉宇內，囊括四海之意，并吞八荒之心。

translations.literal: Qin Xiao gong occupied the Xiao and Han defiles as solid fortifications, embracing Yong province lands, with ruler and ministers firmly guarding and spying on Zhou quarters, having the intent to roll up the world, wrap the universe within, encompass the four seas, and unite and swallow the eight wastes.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Duke Xiao occupied the Xiao and Han defiles as solid fortifications, embracing Yong province lands, with ruler and ministers firmly guarding and spying on Zhou quarters, having the intent to roll up the world, wrap the universe within, encompass the four seas, and unite and swallow the eight wastes.

sentences.zh: 當是時，商君佐之，內立法度，務耕織，修守戰之備，外連衡而鬬諸侯，於是秦人拱手而取西河之外。

translations.literal: When the time came, Duke Xiao died, King Huiwen ascended, and Duke Zhang became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Shang Jun assisted him, internally establishing laws and measures, diligently farming and weaving, repairing defenses for guarding and warfare, externally connecting horizontally and fighting the feudal lords. Thereupon the Qin people took beyond the West River with folded hands.

translations.literal: Qin Duke Xiao occupied Xiaohan's solid fortifications, embraced Yong province land. Ruler and ministers firmly guarded and spied on Zhou chambers. They had the intention to roll up the world, wrap the universe within, encompass the four seas in a bag. Their heart was to unite and swallow the eight wastes. At this time, Lord Shang assisted him. Internally established laws and measures, devoted to agriculture and weaving, repaired defense and battle preparations. Externally connected horizontally and fought the feudal lords. Thereupon Qin people clasped hands and took beyond the Xi River.

sentences.zh: 孝公既沒，惠王、武王蒙故業，因遺冊，南兼漢中，西舉巴、蜀，東割膏腴之地，收要害之郡。

translations.literal: Zhang and Xiao together planned to attack Zhou, and Zhou was terrified.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao having died, King Hui and King Wu inherited the old enterprise, following the bequeathed strategies, south uniting Hanzhong, west taking Ba and Shu, east cutting rich and fertile lands, collecting key strategic commanderies.

sentences.zh: 諸侯恐懼，會盟而謀弱秦，不愛珍器重寶肥美之地，以致天下之士，合從締交，相與為一。

translations.literal: At this time, Qi had Meng Chang, Zhao had Ping Yuan, Chu had Chun Shen, Wei had Xin Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords feared, assembled and allied to plan weakening Qin, not sparing precious vessels, heavy treasures, or fertile lands, to attract the world's scholars, allied together, established relations, mutually became one.

sentences.zh: 當是時，齊有孟嘗，趙有平原，楚有春申，魏有信陵。

translations.literal: This was the beginning of the Four Gentlemen of the Warring States.

sentences.zh: 是二世之過也。

translations.literal: Qin annexed within the seas, united the feudal lords, faced south and called emperor to nourish the four seas. The scholars of the world abundantly turned toward the wind—like this, what was it?
translations.idiomatic: This was the Second Emperor's fault.

translations.literal: Now Qin Second Generation is established. The world none do not stretch necks and observe its governance. Those who are cold benefit from coarse hemp, those who are hungry find bran husks sweet. The world's cries are the new lord's resources. This says labored people are easy to be benevolent with. Suppose the Second Generation had had ordinary lord conduct and employed the loyal and worthy. Minister and lord would be one heart worrying about within the seas' troubles. They would wear white silk and correct the former emperor's faults. Split land and divided people to enfeoff meritorious ministers' descendants. Built countries and established lords with rites for the world. Emptied prisons and freed punishments and executions. Removed confiscated properties and filthy crimes. Made each return to their villages. Opened granaries and scattered wealth and money to raise the isolated, alone, poor, and difficult scholars. Light taxes and few affairs to assist the common people's urgency. Simplified laws and reduced punishments to hold their later ones. Made all the world's people obtain self-renewal. Changed conduct and practiced. Each careful of their bodies. Filled the myriad people's hopes. And gave the world with might and virtue. The world would have gathered. Then within the four seas, all would be happy and each peacefully happy in their places, only fearing there was change. Though there were crafty and slippery people, none would have hearts separated from above. Then the not proper ministers would have no way to adorn their wisdom, and violent chaos evil would have stopped. The Second Generation did not practice this art, and was heavy with without way. He ruined clan temples with the people. Moreover began making the Efang Palace. Numerous punishments and strict executions. Officials' governance harsh and deep. Rewards and punishments not proper. Taxes and collections without measure. The world had many affairs. Officials were not able to record. Common people were poor and difficult, and the lord did not receive and care for them. Then evil and false together rose. Upper and lower mutually fled. Those falsely accused of crimes were many. Punishments and executions mutually seen on the road. And the world suffered it. From lords and nobles below to the common people, people cherished a self-danger heart. They personally dwelt in the reality of poor bitterness. All were not peaceful in their positions. Therefore they were easy to move. Therefore Chen She did not use Tang and Wu's worthiness, did not rely on dukes and marquises' honor. He raised arms at the great marsh and the world echoed and responded. Their people were dangerous. Therefore former kings saw the beginning and end changes, knew the existence and perishing mechanisms. Therefore the way of shepherding people was devoted to peace for them only. Though the world had contrary conduct ministers, there would certainly be no echoed and responded help. Therefore it is said 'peace people can practice righteousness with, and danger people are easy to do wrong with'. This is what is called. Noble as emperor, rich and had the world. The body did not escape punishments and killings. The governance was toppled and wrong. This was the Second Generation's fault.

translations.idiomatic: King Daowu ascended the throne at nineteen years of age.

translations.idiomatic: King Zhaoxiang ascended the throne at nineteen years of age.

translations.idiomatic: In his fourth year on the throne, the well-field system was first abolished, opening up the paths and boundaries between fields.

translations.literal: King Zhao Xiang was born nineteen years then established. Established in the fourth year, initially for fields he opened paths and boundaries.

translations.literal: King Zhuangxiang was born thirty-two years then established.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuangxiang ascended the throne at thirty-two years of age.

sentences.zh: 立二年，取太原地。

translations.literal: In the second year of his establishment, took Taiyuan territory.
translations.idiomatic: In his second year on the throne, he conquered the territory of Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉，布惠於民。

translations.literal: In King Zhuangxiang's first year, great amnesty, honored former kings' meritorious ministers, bestowed virtue generously on relatives, spread favor among the people.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Zhuangxiang's reign, there was a general amnesty. He honored the meritorious ministers of previous kings, treated his relatives with generous virtue, and spread benevolence among the people.

sentences.zh: 東周與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: Eastern Zhou conspired with the feudal lords against Qin, Qin sent Chancellor Lü Buwei to execute him, completely annexed his state.
translations.idiomatic: The Eastern Zhou conspired with the other feudal lords against Qin. Qin dispatched Chancellor Lü Buwei to execute their ruler and completely absorbed his territory.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.literal: Qin did not cut off his sacrifices, with Yangren territory granted the Lord of Zhou, to continue his ancestral rites.
translations.idiomatic: Qin did not extinguish his lineage, granting the Lord of Zhou territory in Yangren to maintain his ancestral sacrifices.

translations.literal: King Zhuang Xiang was born thirty-two years then established. Established in the second year, he took Taiyuan land. King Zhuang Xiang's first year, great pardon. Repaired former king meritorious ministers. Bestowed virtue thickly on relatives. Spread favor to the people. East Zhou plotted with feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Buwei execute him and completely entered his state. Qin did not cut off his sacrifices. With Yangren land they granted the Zhou jun and offered his sacrifices.

translations.idiomatic: He was buried in Liyi.

translations.idiomatic: He was buried at Yichun.

translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao became Chancellor and Marquis of Anwu.

translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor ascended the throne at twelve years of age.

translations.literal: The Second Generation Emperor enjoyed the country for three years. Buried at Yichun. Zhao Gao was Chancellor Marquis An Wu. The Second Generation was born twelve years then established.

translations.literal: From Duke Xiang of Qin to the Second Emperor, six hundred and ten years.
translations.idiomatic: From Duke Xiang of Qin to the Second Emperor was six hundred and ten years.

translations.literal: From Qin Duke Xiang to the Second Generation, six hundred ten years.

sentences.zh: 周歷已移，仁不代母。

translations.literal: The Zhou calendar had already shifted, benevolence does not replace the mother.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou calendar had already been superseded; benevolence cannot replace maternal authority.

sentences.zh: 秦直其位，呂政殘虐。

translations.literal: Qin took its position directly, Lü Zheng was cruel and tyrannical.
translations.idiomatic: Qin seized power directly; Lü Zheng was cruel and tyrannical.

sentences.zh: 然以諸侯十三，并兼天下，極情縱欲，養育宗親。

translations.literal: Yet with thirteen feudal lords, unified and annexed all under heaven, indulged passions and desires to the extreme, nurtured and raised relatives of the clan.
translations.idiomatic: Yet starting with thirteen feudal lords, he unified and annexed all under heaven. He indulged his passions and desires to the extreme, nurturing and raising his clan relatives.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，兵無所不加，制作政令，施於後王。

translations.literal: Thirty-seven years, armies applied everywhere, created systems and commands, applied to later kings.
translations.idiomatic: For thirty-seven years, his armies were deployed everywhere. He created systems and commands that were applied to later kings.

sentences.zh: 蓋得聖人之威，河神授圖，據狼、狐，蹈參、伐，佐政驅除，距之稱始皇。

translations.literal: Indeed obtained sage's authority, river god bestowed charts, held Lang and Hu, trod Can and Fa, assisted government drove out, pushed away called First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: He obtained the authority of a sage; the river god bestowed charts upon him. He held the constellations Lang and Hu, trod upon Can and Fa. He assisted in government and drove out evil, thus was called the First Emperor.

translations.literal: The Zhou calendar had already shifted. Benevolence did not replace the mother. Qin took its position directly. Lu Zheng was cruel and tyrannical. However with thirteen feudal lords, united and annexed the world. Extreme feelings indulged desires. Nourished and raised clan relatives. Thirty-seven years, troops were added everywhere. Created governance and commands, applied to later kings. Probably obtained sage might. The river god gave the diagram. Occupied wolf and fox. Trode Shen and Fu. Assisted governance and drove away. Rejected it and was called Beginning Emperor.

sentences.zh: 始皇既歿，胡亥極愚，酈山未畢，復作阿房，以遂前策。

translations.literal: First Emperor already dead, Hu Hai extremely foolish, Lishan not finished, again made Epang, to fulfill previous strategy.
translations.idiomatic: After the First Emperor died, Hu Hai was extremely foolish. Lishan was not yet finished, yet he resumed construction of Epang Palace to fulfill the previous strategy.

sentences.zh: 云「凡所為貴有天下者，肆意極欲，大臣至欲罷先君所為」。

translations.literal: Said 'all what done noble having world ones, unrestrained intentions extreme desires, ministers even wished dismiss former lord what did'.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Changping Jun and Changwen Jun as generals.

translations.literal: Executed Si and Quji, employed Zhao Gao.
translations.idiomatic: He executed Li Si and Zhao Gao's brother Quji, and employed Zhao Gao.

translations.literal: Painful indeed words ah!

translations.literal: Not awe-inspiring then not extol evil, not sincere then not vainly perish, reject it cannot remain, cruel tyranny hastens the deadline, though dwell in advantageously situated state, still cannot survive.
translations.idiomatic: Without awe-inspiring presence, one cannot extol virtue and punish evil. Without sincerity, one will perish in vain. Rejecting good counsel leads to ruin; cruel tyranny hastens destruction. Even in a state with natural advantages, survival becomes impossible.

Cruel and tyrannical to hasten the period. Though dwelt in a conveniently formed country, still not able to exist.

sentences.zh: 子嬰度次得嗣，冠玉冠，佩華紱，車黃屋，從百司，謁七廟。

translations.literal: Ziying assessed the sequence obtained succession, wore jade crown, wore splendid sash, rode yellow-canopied chariot, followed by hundred officials, paid respects at seven ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: Ziying assessed the proper sequence and obtained the succession. He wore the jade crown, donned the splendid sash, rode in the yellow-canopied chariot, was followed by the hundred officials, and paid respects at the seven ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 小人乘非位，莫不怳忽失守，偷安日日，獨能長念卻慮，父子作權，近取於戶牖之閒，竟誅猾臣，為君討賊。

translations.literal: Petty men took improper positions, none not suddenly lost guard, stole peace day by day, alone could long consider reject worries, father and son made authority, took nearby from door window interval, finally executed cunning ministers, for lord eliminated traitors.
translations.idiomatic: Petty men took positions they did not deserve; none failed to suddenly lose their composure and abandon their duties. They sought daily comfort in complacency. Only Ziying could maintain long-term vision and reject shortsighted worries. Father and son wielded authority together, drawing power from their immediate household. In the end, they executed the treacherous ministers and eliminated traitors for their lord.

sentences.zh: 高死之後，賓婚未得盡相勞，餐未及下咽，酒未及濡脣，楚兵已屠關中，真人翔霸上，素車嬰組，奉其符璽，以歸帝者。

translations.literal: After Gao's death, wedding guests had not yet finished exchanging courtesies, food had not yet reached the throat, wine had not yet moistened the lips, when Chu troops had already slaughtered Guanzhong, the Worthy One soared at Baxi, plain chariot with corded yoke, presented his tally and seal, to return to the imperial one.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhao Gao's death, the wedding guests had not yet finished exchanging congratulations. Food had not yet been swallowed, wine had not yet touched their lips, when Chu troops had already massacred the Guanzhong region. The Worthy One appeared at Baxi Hill. In a plain chariot with hempen cords, he presented his imperial tally and seal to submit to the new emperor.

sentences.zh: 鄭伯茅旌鸞刀，嚴王退舍。

translations.literal: Lord of Zheng thatched banner phoenix knife, King Yan retreated abode.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Zheng displayed thatched banners and phoenix-decorated knives; King Yan respectfully withdrew.

sentences.zh: 河決不可復壅，魚爛不可復全。

translations.literal: River breached cannot again be dammed, fish rotten cannot again be whole.
translations.idiomatic: A breached river cannot be dammed again; rotten fish cannot be made whole.

translations.literal: Popular tradition says Qin Shihuang arose from evil, Hu Hai extreme, obtained its principle.
translations.idiomatic: Popular tradition holds that Qin Shihuang arose from wickedness, and Hu Hai carried it to extremes. This captures the essence of it.

translations.literal: Again blamed the young one, said Qin territory could be preserved, called not understanding changing times.
translations.idiomatic: Yet he again blamed Ziying, saying the Qin territories could have been preserved. This is what is meant by not understanding the changing times.

translations.idiomatic: Ji Ji was enfeoffed at Zui; the Spring and Autumn Annals does not record his name.

translations.literal: I read Qin records, to Ziying cart-dismembered Zhao Gao, never not admired his decision, pitied his aspiration.
translations.idiomatic: When I read the Qin records, especially the part where Ziying had Zhao Gao torn apart by chariots, I cannot but admire his decisiveness and pity his noble intentions.

translations.idiomatic: Ziying fulfilled all the duties of life and death.
